The small things that you can complain about will only be gone with the high end slr cameras, with like 50 point focusing and 11 frames per second...however after having this camera for around a month now, ive taken magnificent photos...the more i use it, the more i learn how to play around with the aperture, the shutter speen and all the other setting, and i will continue to imporove in taking photos..

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the money, but lots to learn
Reviews.Author: LittlePowers "Powers"
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera, with a lot of features to learn. And I reiterate, you have to have a quite a bit of time to learn some of 'em.Perfect for someone who wants to start photography as a hobby.The stock 18-55mm IS lens is a good lens but I suggest getting a second lens. (I went for the 75-300 Telephoto) Make the second lens you choose be for what you need it to be though. Do some research.

Reviews.Title: Got this over the XSi
Reviews.Author: H. Tu
Reviews.Content: I debated on getting this or the XSi, and went with this.  It's 100 bucks cheaper, and this was my first DSLR.  I didn't need the bigger screen or the extra MP.  What I don't like about this camera is the fact it won't accept a wireless shutter remote.  Other than that, I am happy with my first DSLR.  If you were to get a DSLR just to replace your point and shoot or your first DSLR, this is your camera.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Darren M. Burke "dMb"
Reviews.Content: I am definitely a novice who just got tired of using compact pocket type digital cameras and getting bad pictures (usually due to the shutter delay).I know nothing really about photography but I like the size and weight of this camera.  Some reviews suggest it is too expensive for its features but for me the size, weight and supports SD memory were very important.  Quality of the images are amazing (well I think they are!) but I may need to tweak it a bit as the images are huge (3MB+).I am sure as I get better with photography I may start to notice deficiencies but in the meanwhile I am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: K. S. Douglas
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great deal for the price. The image quality is great for such a small SLR. High ISO images are very clean. ISO 800 and 1600 prints at 4x6 and 5x7 have almost no visible noise. I was able to carry this camera around Washington for a week on a single charge and still get hundreds of amazing photos. After a year of using this camera, I can say the only drawback is the slow burst speed. I used this camera with the 17-85, 50 1.8, and 55-250 Canon lenses. All of them deliver great results with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase for those precious moments
Reviews.Author: Scott Grissom
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in Nov 2010 a week or two after the birth of our first child.  I was looking for something better than my old point and shoot camera.  I wanted something that could shoot multiple frames per second and found this camera.  I have taken hundreds of pictures with this camera (some just to figure out the features and some for good pictures of our little girl.)  I have not been disappointed yet.  The pictures are crisp and clear for anything up to poster size and it is incredibly light (for a DSLR) in my hand.  I have a brother-in-law that takes pictures professionally and he uses the XTi and the specs are virtually identical except that the 18-55 lens that comes with this camera has the image stabilizer and his does not.  I don't know what features were "stripped" on the XS from the XSi but for most people I can't imagine that those are critical features.  I was not looking for a camera that took video so this one seemed like the perfect fit.I am completely satisfied with this purchase and would definitely recommend this camera to a friend.

Reviews.Title: This is the ONE
Reviews.Author: John Smith
Reviews.Content: If you searching for an entry level SLR, dost waste your time, buy this one. Its easy to use and picture quality is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great photos with easy to use pre-defined settings
Reviews.Author: Regnard Raquedan
Reviews.Content: I've used my Canon Rebel XS for a few months now and I've been very happy with it. The photos are great, despite me still using the pre-defined settings-- I have yet to master the manual settings.The pre-defined camera settings are easy to understand and use and it's very helpful for DSLR newbies like me.My only little nitpick is the absence of video (even if not HD), because it prompted me to buy a separate device.But over-all, I'd recommend the Rebel XS to folks who'd like to make that DSLR splash.

Reviews.Title: Love my first DSLR!
Reviews.Author: D. Collins
Reviews.Content: I am a mom of 4 young children and photographing them is what I do. I blog to keep record of my children's milestones, accomplishments and shenanigans, and so that the relatives could keep track of how the kids are growing. I post tons of pictures. I've been using a Canon Powershot for about 5 years and have outgrown it. I find myself limited by the camera so it was time for me to upgrade to a DSLR. I've been looking for a year and reading reviews, fiddling at the store displays, and finally I saw the reviews for Canon EOS XS and decided on it.Set up is easy (I am an instruction reader). I attached the lens, I charged the battery and a few hours later I was taking pictures. I took over 200 pictures the first time and I got very good ones.Battery - the battery charge lasts very long. I have yet to recharge it after more than 1000 photos (not taken all at once).It is light and easy to hold.It takes great pictures at low light. Take this with a grain of salt though, because remember that I am upgrading from a point and shoot camera. The night time, indoors pictures I've taken are great.Natural light - I am loving taking pictures with natural light and use the flash as little as possible. With this camera, I've taken great pictures with natural light (even indoors). Of course you need to familiarize yourself with Shutter speed, F stops and all that. But with the fully automatic modes, even with the flash off, it's tons better than point and shoot cameras.Over all, I love it! I can't take very close up with the lens it comes with though - as it is only 3x optical zoom. So I'll need to buy a better lens for sports and school performances.Highly recommended for first time DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Not much wrong here.
Reviews.Author: Jackson Farley
Reviews.Content: It's said that no matter what DSLR you buy, you have the potential to get top notch pictures, no matter the brand or model. Obviously, as you climb higher on the list of dslr models, they get nicer and nicer. But if you're a beginner, this camera can do all you want.This camera is truly amazing.Display: Awesome! The Canon XSi has a bit bigger screen which is why some choose that, but no big deal to me, this one is JUST FINE!Ease of use: Very easy to use. Couldnt be simpler.Features: Packed with features. The only one that I am very sad to be missing is the option to use a wireless remote. I dont know the name of it but there's like a wireless signal that they left out on the XS, which means no wireless remotes for us 1000D users. But we still have the 1o second timer ;)Image quality: GORGEOUS! Ive seen pictures from the XSi and T1i and you can barely tell the difference between those and the XS! Its stunning. Especially outdoors. This camera produces some AMAZING BOKEHS. Theyre simply gorgeous.Battery life: Lasts me weeks. I hardly ever pop out the charger to charge the battery. Its surprising and amazing! Ive thought about buying a spare battery, but at the moment I have no need for one, this one lasts so long.Low light performance: Its alright. Its not terrible, but the shutter speed is slooow in low light, thus causing blurry pictures. But its not too bad.Portability: Very good!Manual controls: All I shoot is manual. Ive been very impressed. And it shows you on a meter how exposed your picture is, which is handy.Shooting speed: Very nice! Sometimes not in low light but no big deal.Overall: BUY THIS CAMERA IF you're a beginner to the DSLR world, or even an amateur. The kit lens is doing me wonders, i cant wait to see what it does with better lenses.Cheers. :)

Reviews.Title: Canon XS
Reviews.Author: Timothy Duffy
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera and have had a wonderful time shooting with it.  From the presets to manual operation, this camera delivers quality.  It is a great first DSLR which will provide many years of learning and quality shooting.  As a videographer, I purchased this entry level camera to improve my shooting composition, but can also bring along on shoots for professional results.  Compact, easily portable, fits well in the hand, and provides great quality results.  Add on some lenses and expand it's capability!  Would purchase again.  I actually prefer this over the xsi.

Reviews.Title: Great Field Camera
Reviews.Author: SierraGolf "Sierragolf"
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of travel and was looking for a lower cost DSLR to take with me.  After reading reviews from [...], dpreview and cnet, I decided to go with the Canon XS. I have no complaints about the ergos or the picture quality.  My wife has the Nikon D60 and I consider this by far a better set up.  The 7 point auto focus is a nice feature for the cost.  The additional megapixels that you get with the xsi is not worth the cost in my opinion.  The 2.5" screen is definitely small by today's standards, but I like the live view function (as far as I know it is the only camera at this cost that has the Live View function).It seems that both the Nikons and the Canons low end SLRs are coming with the IS or VR lenses now.  this is a nice feature, but it adds to the cost of additional lenses.  Having the Stabilization technology in the body of the camera is something to consider if you will be purchasing multiple lenses.  The mission for my camera only requires 2 lenses at most though.As far as picture quality and performance go; we ran some basic tests against my wife's D60.  It was very different to see the difference in the ISO tests we did.  We used people in dark lit situations (more realistic than the scientific pics of cards you see on the research sites). They both are capable of about 3 frames per second which is fine for what we need, but a lot of cameras are capable of more today. The Canon beats it with the AF points and the overall feel and layout of the camera.  Once you learn hoe to use the camera, both are capable of beautiful shots.I like having it in my bag for travel.  It is lower cost so I'm not totally worried about it and it is sophisticated enough to handle any type of landscape or street shot that I come across without disappointing me.  Obviously I recommend it as a travel camera, but if your looking for a good family and friend upgrade from a point and shoot or a tool to launch you into "real" photography, then this is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: N. Gu
Reviews.Content: for $500, this is a much better deal than the point and shoot canon I bought at $330 early last year. I have a toddler. The point and shoot is too slow to capture his move and smile and the details of his face. Point and shoot is very bad under low light. If you have a baby at home, if you can afford $200 extra, please get this $500 deal. I regret I did not buy it in the first place. I could have captured much better pictures when he was a little infant.

Reviews.Title: First time digital SLR owner
Reviews.Author: Alan W. Syler "Big Al"
Reviews.Content: The Canon Rebel XS is my first digital SLR camera.  By no means is it my first Canon.  I owned a Canon AE-1, which I was crazy about.The camera appears to fairly well built, and you have a huge number of lenses from which to choose depending on how much you want to spend.  Make sure you purchase lenses that are EF-S, you want the stabilized lenses.I'm having a little trouble with the auto focus, but I think it's my problem.  Since I've only used the camera once, I need to practice more.  I've ordered a detachable flash to go on the camera.  I want the ability to bounce the flash for certain pictures.All in all I pleased with my purchase.  I'll be even happier when I can purchase the Canon EF-S 70-250mm lense.

Reviews.Title: Excellent way to step up to digital SLR
Reviews.Author: Jack Cameron
Reviews.Content: As an old Canon AE1 user (still have it in the closet) I switched to digital very early on.  Upgrading about every 3 years to higher megapixels and greater zoom range.  I got spoiled by live view standard with all point and shoots, so I resisted SLR until that feature became available.  My last camera was a professional series Kodak P850 which had every feature of an SLR plus live view (manual focus over ride, 12X optical Ziess lense, and more).  My renewed interest started when Olympus launched live view on their SLR.  Thought that was the way I would go until I compared the Canon side by side.  The live view feature on the Canon is not as good or versatile as the Olympus but the other features to me, were better especially feel and handling.  Canon offered SD media which was the standard of all my previous cameras and other electronics (the Olympus had CF).  My next delima was whether to go with the XS or step up to the XSi with larger LCD and 12 megapixel quality.  I went with the XS on price and am extremely pleased.  The ease of use and quality of photos are superb.  I shoot mostly at 5 megapixels to conserve file size and they are excellent.  File size is about 2 mg.  Live view turned out to be no big deal.  Once I got an SLR back in my hands after these many years, I found I enjoyed the view finder and even manual focus the way I go on most shots.  Auto focus and live view are still there and good when you hand off the camera to someone else to click your family photos.  The kit lense of 18 - 55 is very nice particularly for indoors but I am anxious to add a 55 - 250 as most of my shots are outdoors.  The lense at 28 tends to bend the photo but does help in confined spaces.  Very easy to use right out of the box.  Full instruction book not a CD is very helpful.  If you have hesitated like I did, buy the Canon with confidence.  I am certainly happy with my decision and hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Great SLR for Amateur Photogs!
Reviews.Author: K. Adams "Shopaholic"
Reviews.Content: This camera is definitely a must-have for anyone who cares about the visual quality of their pictures.  It can be adjusted to be as creative or simple as you want it to be, and it's easy to learn how to use on the creative side.  I spent a good 2 hours going through the functions and settings, and then just starting playing with it.  I used it a lot over the holidays, and I'm learning how to compose my pictures and take better looking shots with just a couple of quick adjustments on the fly.  The price and accessories included with this in the kit make it a must have purchase, which will be a good long-term investment.  I highly recommend buying a good telephoto lens as well, because the kit lens is only good to about 30 yards.  All in all, this is a great value and investment.

Reviews.Title: Cannon XS Rebel SLR Digial Camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph Allen
Reviews.Content: As a long time professional Videoographer, I find little time to enjoy working with fillm cameras. When my old SLR got dropped I finally broke down and got a state of the art entry level camera in digidal. Who needs all the bells and whistles if you know how to use a camera? they are all her in spades and show a lot of fore thought. There are things I would have never thought of putting on a camera, post work yes just not on the camera. It is for all who think they are going to grow into the photo job field, and will make a lot of money if the tallent is there. If not it is a low cost camera and will not break the bank if the tallent dos'nt show up later in life. I love this camera and would not want the next level up, it was more than I would ever use, I'm never going to be Jimmy Olsen, so I will keep the XS, thank you Cannon it is great.

Reviews.Title: PROBABLY THE BEST DEAL OF MY LIFE...
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I picked this camera up to have something I didn't mind dragging around while learning the basics of photography. It was refurbished, and incredibly affordable.My expectations were not very high.What I received was a camera that looks new, and is incredible.  No, it doesn't shoot video, it simply takes pictures that rival my brothers 5D MkII. His L lens cost 10 times what this camera and the STM kit lens cost.If you are interested in learning Photography, this is an incredible gateway into DSLR technology that you can actually afford.  I love this little camera!Michael

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Snookums
Reviews.Content: This is a great DSLR camera for a great price.  As someone just learning to use a DSLR camera, I like that it can take great pictures in automatic modes but you can also use manual modes and customize your picture settings.

Reviews.Title: My Canon can beat your nIkOn
Reviews.Author: Big c "the big guy in the part"
Reviews.Content: I am a semi-pro photographer...(which means I have been paid for my photographs in the past). Having said that, I must admit, this camera is by far the best DSLR out there for the money. I have used film and digital cameras since 1973. I have had my photographs published in newspapers and the cover of a magazine [ INDUSTRIAL PHOTOGRAPHY ]. This camera gives you full range of control, from 100% point and shoot to setting ISO, f stop and shutter speed etc. Would I buy this camera again..yes...so should you!

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera! Perfect transition choice!
Reviews.Author: B. Dawson "HisMrsHooah"
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera as my transition from a regular point-and-shoot to a DSLR. I've been into photography for years and finally decided to make the jump and get a DSLR.This camera is absolutely amazing. I was worried that it would be hard for me to figure out the settings or that it would be too bulky in my hands. (I had went to Best Buy prior to my purchase and held a couple of similar cameras in my hands, but they didn't have this exact model, so I didn't get to test this one out before buying). I'm a big Canon fan, so I wasn't too worried about not liking the camera, but I was worried that someone like me, who has no professional background in photography, would have issues figuring out how to use it. No such thing!! It is completely easy to use and I've been having nothing but fun experimenting with the lenses (I bought an extra, a telephoto lens that is awesome!) and all the different settings. I'm definitely still learning, but I've already taken some absolutely beautiful photos with the new camera and I am 100% happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Matthew Rice
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a little over a year ago and I still love it! If you are still shooting with a point and shoot and need faster shudder speeds,this would be a good product to consider. The battery life last about 450 shots or so which is more than enough for my purposes. The construction is very good, however I do not really care for the plastic grip. Although the display is small, I still enjoy using it. When using Live view, I sometimes find it hard to focus because detail on the small screen is hard to see. As a beginner in DSLR photography, I was intimidated by this big camera. At first I mainly stuck with auto mode and occasionally ventured into program mode. After a month of using this camera I was using Manual mode almost full time. Many reviewers were surprised at the size of the camera. This is NOT a point and shoot camera that you can stuff in your pocket and go!. This is for photo hobbyists who need a quality camera and are will to trade in portability for quality. One gripe that i have is that the flash is not very powerful. However, this can be easily fixed with a external flash (I use the canon 430 EX II and it is great!). Overall i would highly recommend the Canon Rebel XS.

Reviews.Title: Good Entry level DSLR
Reviews.Author: Randall
Reviews.Content: This camera is an excellent entry level DSLR for anyone who is making the transition from fixed focus cameras into the world of DSLR. The kit lens is image stabilized and offers many of the features of larger or more expensive higher end cameras. However those features are often less high end than those same cameras. Such as only having a 7 point auto-focus versus a 9 or 11 point.  For the price this is an excellent choice for someone just getting into the realm of DSLR. If you are coming from high end 35mm film cameras this is NOT the camera for you to be honest.  If you want that level I suggest getting yourself a nice Canon 5D mark II or similar.  The camera has all the shooting modes you would expect such as Manual (M), Program (P), Shutter Priority (Tv), Aperture Priority (Av), and Fully Automatic.  It also has Portrait, Landscape, Macro, Action, Nighttime, and no flash modes.  Plenty of modes to choose from, though I generally shoot in only Manual, Av and Tv modes. All of the controls are easily reachable and pretty intuitive. The screen is easily usable in Live View mode and the viewfinder is easy to see through and easy to read the settings in both without any problems..

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: K. Kalvelage
Reviews.Content: This is my first high quality I have purchased. I have used other professional quality cameras on borrow. This camera is great for a beginner. Very simple to use on the present shooting settings and easy to learn how to manipulate the other settings. The settings are easy to use once you have located them. This camera produces very high quality photos and is easy to download to the computer and charge the battery. I highly recommend this camera to a beginner looking for a high quality camera to learn photography. Great quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great SLR Camera for the Beginner
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Pierce "Stephanie"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an old 3 megapixel point and shoot camera, because that one just couldn't keep up with my small children. This was my first SLR, and it has been a great one for me as a beginner. I haven't bought any extra lenses or anything; I mostly just use it on full-auto mode, which means it auto-focuses, auto-flashes, etc. Super easy for those who don't want to take the time to read a manual or learn all the features. It isn't great in low light, but otherwise the image quality is that of a much more expensive camera. Shutter speed is ultra fast, except when you take more than 5 or 6 pictures in rapid succession. The battery lasts me months, and I have 2 small children that I like to take pictures of! Overall a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Professional Quality with an amateurs ease
Reviews.Author: C. Bregoli
Reviews.Content: We have a small child and in the month we have had this camera I have used it nearly every day. It's a great camera that is simply FUN to use!!! It provides professional quality images with an amateurs ease. Whether you choose the fully automatic or the manual settings it is so easy to clearly catch any image you are shooting at. Even if it is moving or in low light. This camera is amazing, I Love it more every time I use it. Thank you Amazon...

Reviews.Title: Good starter camera for semi-professional
Reviews.Author: Nic-o-la-us
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after a long wait and made sure to do my research. The other camera I was considering was the NIKON D3000.I chose this camera because while researching the differences it seemed that the NIKON site had less information to offer and customer support is important to me.I took a year of photography in college and am still a novice at best but have always enjoyed shooting photos.This camera has been a joy to use and I love the software and OS that Canon has developed.You have enough options that it takes a while to learn them but once you get the hang of it and set your personal settings, the camera is a blast.setting it to the medium setting at apx 5 mega pixels gives you very clear large photos of people or small groups.I havent taken it on a nature hike yet but the macro has done some beautiful things with documents as well as close ups of my dog.If you are borderline deciding on this camera, remember it is a DSLR and is much larger than a point and shoot, and if you're anything like me you will baby this camera and feel protective of it. it doesnt seem to be very rugged but its also much more sensitive than a regular point and shoot.Hope this was helpful!

Reviews.Title: Great starter Canon DSLR Kit
Reviews.Author: E. Escobar
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for an amateur photographer, the best thing is that it includes this 18-55mm lens. Yes this lens has its limitations but you shouldn't expect too much since the price is very affordable. I have tried other lenses and I can tell you by experience that this lens is not made for low light. I highly recommend this kit.

Reviews.Title: great SLR for amateurs
Reviews.Author: Let's go sharks
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. If you spend about half an hour studying up on the features and how to use it you can take awesome photos. I recommend it for anyone who wants to take really nice photos even though they don't really know what they're doing. It's probably even better if you do know what you're doing, but I can't vouch for that personally.

Reviews.Title: Loving my new Rebel
Reviews.Author: Cakegirl
Reviews.Content: I am really pleased with the Canon Rebel XS. I did a lot of research and asking around before I decided to take the plunge, as I was debating between Nikon and Canon for a little while. I went to a local store and held both models in my hand and played with the controls. I chose the Canon mostly because it was the one that my photographer friends recommended to me, and I also thought the controls and display were much more user-friendly on the Canon. I am very happy with it! So far, it has been pretty simple to figure out, if you are willing to read some of the manual and do a little research on camera settings and terminology. It's a really great camera for the money!

Reviews.Title: Awesome, but I'd pick the XSi body only if I could go back
Reviews.Author: GRM
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Upgrading to a DLSR has made a huge difference in my photos. I had read some reviews and done some research before buying this camera, but now that I've had more experience in using it, there are a couple things I'd change if I could make this decision again. First off, I was impatient and bought the XS because they were out of the XSi where I saw a great deal on it. I didn't want to spend more though. Second, I wish I had thought about whether or not I'd want to be able to use a wireless remote to take photos because this one is not capable of that. Lastly, if I had personally exprienced the difference that the lenses would make and known that I'd want to invest in some really good lenses, I would've bought a camera body only and saved the difference to put towards better lenses.

Reviews.Title: Great First DSLR!
Reviews.Author: LylasMama
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after my daughter was born and my point and shoot left us disspointed with all of her baby pictures. As a busy new mom, I didn't have time to learn how to use it for quite some time, and left it in full auto for months, and still got really nice pictures...compared to my point and shoot at least. Several months later, I've graduated to AV and I'm learning the ropes. I'm sure a pro would say that my pictures are okay for just someone taking them at home with no training, but friends and family are constantly asking for the name of my photographer, haha. I finally got my prime lens the other day and the "nifty fifty" results in incredible photos! I love that I didn't have to spend a small fortune to do all of this. As a beginner, I wanted to walk away with a really nice camera and gadgets for less than a grand and that's what I did. I have the two lenses that came with the body and the Canon 50 mm 1.8, which was an additional $90. I have a great bag that holds everything, plus our camcorder, filters, extra battery, and there's still room for an extra body! Great quality and a great deal! Love Canon!

Reviews.Title: Great beginner SLR
Reviews.Author: Katherine E. Warren "katieewarren"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 3 months ago. I LOVE it. I have shot a big variety of things with it: nature, people, food, etc. I did a ton of research before buying, and right now I still just have the kit lens, but I feel like this camera gives me exactly what I wanted:great quality, beautiful pictures. It is small and portable compared to the higher end SLR's, and all the functions you need on the camera are on the face of it, so you aren't always having to flick through the menu. I sometimes feel limited, like if I want to take a macro shot, but that would be better if I had a different lens. I am hesitant to use the flash, although sometimes this bites me in the butt. In dim light, the camera doesn't do so well without flash, and the blur you get doesn't really show up on the display; only later can you tell that the photo is blurry. Overall though, any photo hobbyist would have a great time with this camera. It is great for traveling or just taking photos of everyday things, and your photos will have a sharp professional look to them that they wouldn't with a point and shoot.  Have fun!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera When Upgrading From A Traditional Point and Shoot!  Amazing!!
Reviews.Author: Sean LeClaire
Reviews.Content: This is my first "professional" high-end digital camera and I can't be more satisfied.  We have two kids, one in sports & theater and our traditional small point-n-shoot camera just wasn't cutting it.  We are now capturing amazing photos that look like a professional photographer took.  I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: My First DSLR
Reviews.Author: G. Coronado
Reviews.Content: This was my first DSLR. I wanted to buy a high zoom camera back then but I realized that the size of the camera that I wanted to buy was almost the same as this one. So, I decided that I wanted the flexibility of having a camera that has an interchangeable lens system so I went for this.It's a very good first DSLR. I learned a lot with it, started in the P-mode, then graduated to Av-Mode. I got really good pictures from this and I was able to document significant memories in the early stages of my life with my wife. The pictures were great but I couldn't get anything really useable with shots taken beyond ISO 800. The shot rate is slow so I couldn't follow shooting wild geese, but otherwise, I was able to get really good pics of my friend's then 4 year old son.I have now since replaced this with a Canon 7D and I've passed this on to a friend but I had great memories of this camera. Looking back, I regretted having given this up. It would've been a nice second, carry-everyday DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Great first SLR
Reviews.Author: Chelsea
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  I was getting really annoyed with my old point and shoot because I couldn't get the quality photos that I wanted.  For someone who is getting their first DSLR I would totally recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Digital Starter
Reviews.Author: Conrad Weiler "pictorial arts lover"
Reviews.Content: Overall the Canon Rebel XS is a wonderful starter DSLR camera. I have always found the Canon lenses to be of the highest quality and giving good picture results. However, if this is your first digital camera or first DSLR camera - be prepared for a learning curve. The camera manual is well written and offers many useful tips for photography using this camera.The kit lens, 18-55mm, is a good starting lens. Later, if you desire, other lenses may be added for various shooting objectives. The price at Amazon makes entry into the DSLR field both easier and starts with a Canon a delight.Conrad WeilerCamp Sherman, Oregon

Reviews.Title: Rebel XS- Great Product
Reviews.Author: Tommy2424
Reviews.Content: Great camera. I am new to the SLR world, but this one proves to be a fantastic product for an SLR beginner. Definitely a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera to get started with (and save some money towards lenses and filters!)
Reviews.Author: N. Skinner "Ranthil"
Reviews.Content: I come from having used Canon SLRs since 2007.  Canon Digital Rebel XTi 10.1MP Digital SLR Camera with EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 Lens (Black) was my first dSLR, and I fell in love.  The Rebel XS is my replacement for the Rebel XTi, and the only reason the XTi is being replaced is because it was stolen.The differences between Nikon and Canon, are in my opinion minimal as far as quality goes.  The larger difference is in personal comfort between the two, assuming no oddities.  (NOTE - I used a Nikon D3000 10.2MP Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom Lens and found that the images were not as sharp as what I had experienced with my Canon).Part of my enjoyment of the "low-end" Canon dSLRs is the cost.  Simply put, it gives me more money to spend on lenses, filters, and the other items which last.Pros:1) Cost.  The Rebel XS is about as inexpensive as a dSLR can get and still be up-to-date.2) Ergonomics.  I find the Rebel XS fits comfortably in my hands, that the buttons are easily found,(and to me at least) logically located.3) Weight.  When carrying my kit up the mountains, ounces start to add up, and the Rebel XS is a very light camera.4) Images.  Image quality (except as noted in Cons), is superb, and the resolution more than adequate for 8x10 prints even with considerable cropping.Cons:1) Low-light performance.  Compared to the XTi, I find that the Rebel XS has more digital noise at higher resolutions.  I wish that it had a max-ISO limiter, like is found on the Nikons.2) Not weather sealed.  Unlike the top of the line Canons, the XS is not weather sealed.Overall, for anyone who is getting into dSLRs, or needs a backup dSLR, I would recommend the Rebel XS.  It enjoys most of the features of the higher priced prosumer dSLRs with none of the cost.  The included kit lens is a nice addition, with included IS.  The XS might not be the most expensive, or the flashiest camera, but it will leave you with enough money in your pocket for another lens, such as the Canon EF 70-200mm f/4L USM Telephoto Zoom Lens for Canon SLR Cameras, or a flash Canon Speedlite 580EX II Flash for Canon EOS Digital SLR Cameras and keep you within $1000.

Reviews.Title: to the point...
Reviews.Author: B. Dropping
Reviews.Content: if you are a new to slr cameras, this is perfect for you. you may see the rebel xsi and want to get that one, but don't. get this one. save your money on the camera and invest in the lenses. 10 vs 12 MP isn't that big. buy the xsi if you want to print poster sized. all in all, great price with great results.

Reviews.Title: USER FRIENDLY 100% - Canon Rebel XS 10.1MP DSLR 12-2009
Reviews.Author: Houston2011
Reviews.Content: 1) This camera is user friendly right out of the box. From full auto to different user definables, pleasure to use, intuitive; great entry level and now very affordable.2) Photos look great on the computer. Pop the SDHC memory card out (you provide that) and upload via card reader; or connect camera straight into USB connection - works great. I use a Mac OS X 10.4.11 and no issues.3) The Canon Rebel XS 10.1MP Digital SLR is a faster photo taking camera then ANY of my point and shoot cameras. Hands down.4) Reviewing images is easy with direct button review and trashing any pics you didn't like takes seconds - so nice.  Easy to manage memory space.5) Has more menu options than most people will need - certainly more than I will need.6) Memory card SDHC type is compatible with other cameras, very useful.7) Buttons are  in all the right places, a pleasure because for more experienced amateur photographers, I found that it seems finally that the buttons are now where they make sense to be.8) Disregard other reviews saying grip is "petite" I have large hands and it works fine. Thumb has a perfect spot to hold and the index finger hits the button perfectly.9) No comments on included software; Canon web site appears very user friendly. Be sure to check support section for notices. Site appears very up to date.10) No comments on Battery Life - batteries are batteries.11) MY FAVORITE FEATURE? Favorite menu option is the multiple shot timer - you define how many shots for the timer for family pics, and away it goes - simple but beautiful.12) MY HARDEST CRITIQUE? It's a tedious detail, and all SLR cameras have it to some degree, but the external flash mount sticks out a bit and as you slide camera into a camera case/bag it has a tendency to hang up - maybe one of you readers could invent a little plastic cap that slides on there so it is smooth ? Otherwise it is hard to find something I don't like about this camera as a non-professional photographer (in this price range).Best camera I have ever had my hands on as an amateur photographer - it will be with me a long time.  Enjoy it!!!

Reviews.Title: A gift given.
Reviews.Author: Larry K. Lednik
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift after doing many hours of research to find a good value on this great Digital SLR. The giftee says I did a wonderful job. It is highly rated in the consumers magazine I subscribe to. I have seen some wonderful pictures taken with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: mkim
Reviews.Content: Love love this camera!  We get compliments all the time on our pictures and have also taken pics for others even though I am by no means at all a professional photographer...not even close, very amateur.  The camera does all the work.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera for an entry-level
Reviews.Author: jgfb415
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks reading through both user and professional reviews and comparing it against similar 10 megapixel cameras, super zoom cameras and even 12 megapixel cameras and this one beat them all out hands down. Yes even the XSi of the same brandNot only is the price right but this an ideal camera for those just starting out in the DSLR world like me. The controls and menus are simple enough that you can start taking pictures just about out of the box. If you are feeling adventurous and want to get into the creative side of the dial those aren't all that hard to get a hang of either. Still this isn't the best part.The best part in my opinion is the spectacular image quality that comes out of an entry level DSLR. Even when you have to turn the ISO up the image doesn't have much noise.Sure it only has a 2.5 inch screen, a 7 point AF system and doesn't shoot that fast in raw but at least in my opinion those downsides are negligible.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: A. Bannigan
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. After consulting various friends with different Canons and other digital SLRs, I decided not to go top-of-the-line for the body and use the difference in price to buy an extra lens. After all, as one of my friends put it "the lenses last forever, the bodies don't". The extra features on the XSi are overkill for the average photographer, I think, and this camera takes lovely photos and is easy to use. Another lens with a bigger zoom is really a must, but the 18-55mm lens is a nice general purpose lens.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Nicki
Reviews.Content: We're very happy with this camera. We are beginners as far as photography is concerned, and there is plenty to keep us busy learning with this camera. The menu is pretty user-friendly - I was playing around with settings and able to understand what I was doing within the first little bit. The battery is great - charges quickly and lasts a long time. The camera feels well-built but is not too heavy. It's a great size, easy to carry around. Probably my most favorite things about it are how quickly it turns on and is ready to shoot pictures, and how fast it is in between pictures - I can take pictures over and over as fast as I want. Also, picture quality is awesome. For example, I took a picture of my husband and son at the base of a waterfall we had hiked up to. When we reviewed the pictures and zoomed in on the waterfall, we discovered that the camera had captured detail on hikers way up the side of the waterfall that you can't even see in the picture at full size. Overall, we're very very happy with this camera, and if we had to do it all over again, this would be the one we picked. It arrived very quickly with everything well packaged. We couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: The Irish Lady
Reviews.Content: Having taken this to the Caribbean and taken a lot of pictures, I now feel I can rate this camera.  I'm coming off a point and shoot to the DSLR, so I had a lot to learn, but found it easy and enjoyable.I checked out the difference between the stabilizer in the camera, or in the lens.  I checked it out for size and weight before buying it, comparing it to Sony A series and Nikon D40 and D60.  I think it beat both in two areas.  It carried easily through the jungles of Jamaica and Cozumel and it took great pictures while slightly swaying on a cruise ship and the pictures came out very clear.I did all this on a 9 day trip and barely used any of the power in one charge of the battery.  It even went to "Hell" and back (the Bahamas) and was such a good travel camera.  I love how the portrait setting took such good shots of my grandkids and friends, giving their skin a beautiful quality. All in all, a wonderful camera I'll have fun learning inside and out.

Reviews.Title: Loving it
Reviews.Author: Arthur D. Welling "Carteach"
Reviews.Content: No baubles so far, and about 1000 images into ownership.I moved from a higher end Canon P+S into this Canon XS entry level SLR. On the point and shoot, I had about 20,000 images taken and saved. I expect to do the same with this Canon SLR.I'm trying to think of complaints.... and just can't.  The battery was low one evening when I had charged it the day before, but I still managed 400 images of race car practice, many with flash, and the battery stayed with me the whole time.As for image quality.... it's why I moved into this kind of camera and the XS has not disappointed.  My photos are getting serious wows from friends and blog readers, and requests for high def copies.Looking forward to more lenses, most especially a wide aperture prime for portraits.  The kit lens does well at that, but so much more is promised with a 1.8.

Reviews.Title: great entry-level DSLR
Reviews.Author: A. Ivey
Reviews.Content: I've had my canon XS for about a month, and I'm in love with it. I upgraded from a Canon point-and-shoot after becoming more serious about photography. I researched for quite a while, and I found that while the XSi seemed to be the best choice for a first DSLR, the price difference didn't make the jump seem worth it. (I'm a poor college student and I wanted/needed a camera for a class, so I didn't have a lot of money to save up.) One of my flatmates and another friend both have canon XSi's that I've played around with, and I can honestly say that I'm just as pleased with mine.The other reviews make extensive notes on the features, so I won't bother with that, but I will say the only drawback (well, to any canon product) is the software. If you have a Mac, don't bother using it and import through iPhoto.

Reviews.Title: Great for a Serious Beginner
Reviews.Author: Sarah Lynch-Walker
Reviews.Content: The Canon Rebel XS is an incredibly nice intro for a post-point-and-shoot photographer.  The manual is explained quite well (even managing to simplify the concepts of f-stops and shutter speeds), and the camera itself is clever enough to generally get it right when set to Program (auto) mode.For a DSLR, the camera isn't overly heavy, and I haven't felt it to be cumbersome in the variety of shooting situations in which I've used it.The screen is a nice size, and the playbacks seem to mimic the color quality of the RAWs relatively faithfully.One of my few complaints is with the amount of software provided.  While this may seem a bit silly, the number of programs seems superfluous, as many of the functions of one are echoed in another.  With my first two or three file transfers, I was sometimes confused as to why or whether I needed three of their provided programs open at once just to view my images.Overall, the Rebel XS is a quality DSLR, and I'd recommend it to anyone starting out in serious photography.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: K. Somridhivej "skongfah"
Reviews.Content: The 5 Star rating that I based upon is primarily from a great deal from Amazon that got free 75-300 zooms lens and a UV filter. You really can not beat this price. In terms of camera itself, it is really good entry digital SLR camera. Here's pro and con from novice users perspective:Pro:-Overall pictures quality. Better than most entry level digital SLR from other manufacturer.-Very low noise.-extremely light weight and compact size.-Good battery performance. You do not need an extra one.-Pretty good kit len.-Liveview although it is definitely not as good as many people has mentioned. It lags about half a second.Cons:-2.5" LCD is ok but 3" is much better. I got spoil by 3" screen on SD880 which is an excellent wide angle camera.-IS on lens unlike Sony alpha. You almost always need tripod if you put 75-300 lens with no IS on.-ISO 1600 is definitely not as good as Nikon.-Vertical picture does not rotate back and forth when you move camera accordingly. It does rotate (from vertical to horizontal) but not the other way around when you move the camera vertically.Conclusion:If you plan to upgrade SLR camera 5-7 years from now, this should be your first Canon digital SLR camera. If you plan to use SLR for more than 7 years, I would suggest XSi. There will be a better and cheaper digital SLR camera. 7 years from now I'd expect HD video and full frame sensor from entry level camera.XSi VS XSThe different in features between both camera worth about $100. If you don't take RAW pictures (3fps-XSi and 1.5fps-XS), there is even less reason to get XSi.

Reviews.Title: My First DSLR
Reviews.Author: C. Le
Reviews.Content: I've been doing so much research on this camera. Then, I was waiting for three weeks, hoping the price would drop. It did! At 459.95, it is a great price for this wonderful DSLR. If you are a beginner like myself and want a great performing camera for an inexpensive price, I highly suggest getting this over the XSI. Don't hesitate! Get it now! Oh, and the lens that comes with it is amazing especially with the Image Stabilizer.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera, having a lot of fun with it
Reviews.Author: M. Smith
Reviews.Content: Edit 2: I have now had this camera for about 11 months now. I have taken over 8000 photos with this camera, and I'm still going strong! I took my son's 1 year old photos and his Christmas photos for 2012, and again, I had several relatives asking who did the photos because they looked professional. I purchased an economical vinyl photography backdrop and have been using that to take my photos. I still use the two kit lens mentioned below and have recently added a Canon 50mm f/1.8 lens to my arsenal. I am hungry for a more professional grade camera so I can flex my photography muscles, BUT, this camera still takes great photos and I still love using it.Starting out by saying, I highly recommend this camera as a beginner photography camera. I'm basing this review on experience with SLR cameras. I have taken over 1500 pictures with my camera since I have gotten it about a week ago.Okay, I've seen on a couple of reviews for this camera that people are outraged for reasons that have nothing to do with the camera's quality. Going to address those here:**No memory card with this camera: Most of the time when you purchase a digital camera, unless you purchase a special bundle, they will not come with memory cards. There are too many different capacity and speed memory cards, and most cameras that come with a stock memory card come with very poor quality and small capacity cards. If it did come with a card, it would probably be a 2gb card, and people would probably be outraged that it didn't come with a larger memory card. Do your research on memory cards and get yourself a decent sized and decent quality card for your use.**Lens isn't as high quality as they want and upgrading costs lots of money: Well...YEAH. Camera lenses can cost thousands of dollars. If you want to use this camera for something beyond amateur/beginner use, you're going to need to upgrade your lens, because this camera comes with a stock lens. Yes, you're going to get fairly decent pics from this camera without upgrading, but if you need to take wide angle shots, landscape shots, or high detailed close-ups, you have to get a different lens because this lens is not made for the reasons listed. The point of getting this type of camera isn't just high quality, it is the fact that you can change the lens and use the camera for a variety of photography uses. All of that to say, it's a stock lens for basic use.**Camera isn't easy to figure out how to use: Well..YEAH. This is a DSLR camera. You're looking for a Point and Shoot camera, which means that all you have to do is point and shoot to get the camera to work. This camera has more features/functions than a normal Point and Shoot camera, and to get the most out of this camera you need to research about SLR cameras and/or take a class on photography. Yes, there are "easy" modes on this camera, but if you want to get the most out of this camera and want to take pictures that don't look like a point and shoot, you need to learn how to use the camera**Camera doesn't take "fast pictures": this camera has the ability to change shutter speed, which means you can take action shots with this camera, if you have the settings correct. Using the LCD screen instead of the manual view finder means the camera will have extra processing time while taking continuous shots, not to mention your SD card may also delay how quickly you can take pics because of save time to the card itself. As I stated above, do your research on SD cards and get a decent quality SD card. I'm using a Class 10 card on my camera and have had no issues with continuous shots.I am going to admit that I actually have a refurb version of this camera, and it does not have the kit lens with it. I currently own and am experienced with the following cameras: Canon EOS Rebel 2000 35mm Film SLR Camera Kit with 28-80mm Lens, Canon EOS Rebel K2 35mm SLR Camera w/ EF 28-80 II Lens Kit, and Nikon Coolpix L100 10 MP Digital Camera with 15x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom. And yes, I realize the K2 is the upgraded version of the 2000.I love my film cameras. Love them to pieces. I took my son's newborn pics with my K2 and the 28-90mm lens. After basic tweaking of the levels in GIMP, they looked like professional pictures (I was asked by several people "who did them for me"). No complaints about the quality in Canon's film SLR line, but as many people know it is getting more difficult and more expensive to take your film to be developed. With a young child, I don't want to keep the chemicals to do it myself in my house, so finding a place to do it for me is becoming more difficult, and understandably so. Most people getting film developed these days are people who have had a roll of film sitting around their house for 3+ years and expect it to still be viable. BTDT as a film technician at a 1 hour photo place.I love my point and shoot as well. The problem is that I want to have a hobby camera to play around with and take some professional quality photographs of my son that I can send out to the grandparents, godparents, and hang in my house. PaS cameras have a different ratio on the size of the photograph, and I often find that when I take my photos somewhere to be printed the color balance is way off (even if I have photoshopped it to print properly), and that it is grainy (despite my 10 MP L100 Nikon).The best quality prints that I've had have been from my 35mm Canons. I wanted something affordable, and I found it in the Canon Rebel XS. My husband insisted that I continue to use my film cameras, but with the cost of the special batteries the cameras take, the cost of film, the difficulty in finding fast film developing services locally, not to mention the cost to develop film, I have no regrets about purchasing this camera. I can take as many pics as I want, and it doesn't cost me anything extra if I mess up a shot :)Pros:- Easy to use (if you take the time to learn how!!!)- backwards compatibility with my EF lenses- small/lightweight (For a DSLR in any case)- rechargeable battery with charging baseCons:- no dual SD/CF slots or USB mass storage capability.- compact body, not so comfy for bigger hands (my husband specifically in my case)- LCD is 2.5", smaller than my Nikon, but I suppose that also accounts for the smaller body size of the cameraWhile I'd prefer to have a CF slot to use, it is convenient to have an SD slot for use because my Nikon also takes an SD card. It's nice to be able to use the same card on different cameras. I can transfer the images, format the card, and then use it wherever I need it.I mentioned that I took over 1500 pictures. Much of this is due to the fact that I'm using an non Image Stabilization lens with my camera, and I have a VERY mobile 6 month old baby. I don't want to burn out my camera's flash taking pics of him, and so due to poor lighting in my house, I have the ISO jacked up, the aperture wide open, and the lens speed slower than I'd like to get enough light in the pictures. I don't regret it though. It's been a lot of fun experimenting in manual mode and not having to worry about wasting money developing shots that came out poorly.If you are a beginner and you are interested in photography, get this camera, get to know it, and take beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great SLR for a Beginner
Reviews.Author: J. Caputo
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera that can keep up with a toddler.  One that was virtually idiot-proof.  I needed a camera that was complete, didn't require any additonal lenses.  I wanted one that made it easy to capture the shot that I wanted, in a way that I wanted.  One that could zoom in and out, focus for me.  I also wanted one that I could talk the reins on, should I choose to do so.  This camera did not disappoint me at all.  I bought this over a year ago and have not regretted it.  My pictures are clear and crisp.  The response time of the shutter is nearly immediate which allows me to grab that instant before my son dart out of the shot (even indoors!). I am still impressed by Canon (this is my second Canon owned).

Reviews.Title: Does the Canon XS match up to the compeition??
Reviews.Author: Belly A.
Reviews.Content: First off I bought this camera November 09, so its been a year of ownership. I have to say it is a great camera for people who just wants good pictures and be interested in exploring the photography world. For people who are enthusiast, this camera falls short. The screen is only a 2.5in which is bare minimum in today's standards. At 10.1 Megapixels, it doesn't really matter unless you're making huge posters or big framework. The shooting speed on the camera is also slow at 3fps in JPEG and 1.5 in RAW. The focusing on this camera is good during the day time or in places with a lot of light, but takes awhile in low light situations. All these issues have been said before, so I'll leave it at that. On the upside, if you're just taking pictures and viewing them on a computer majority of the time. The image quality is an improvement from Point-And-Shoot Cameras. Hook this camera up with a better lens or a 50mm 1.8II, The picture quality will look as good as any upper Canon Rebels. Remember, it is all about the person using the camera, not the equipment. It's like using a pen, anyone can use a nice inky pen, but it is the person who uses the pen to write novels and articles.  Overall I would recommend this camera for people who want to dip their feet into the digital SLR scene without spending too much.

Reviews.Title: Canon XS much better than the rest!
Reviews.Author: Vinay Patil "Vinay"
Reviews.Content: The Canon Rebel XS is a beginner's delight for many reasons. First, it comes with good kit lens (18-55 mm with Image Stabilizer). The kit lens is said to be one of the best in the entry level SLR's. Secondly, it has 10.1 megapixel CMOS sensor and DIGIC III processor and it shares an interface with almost every current Canon DSLR all the way up to the Canon EOS-1Ds Mark III. The pictures come out highly detailed, noise-free and sharp. The camera is light weight (but doesn't feel cheap or fragile) and memory slot holds SD/SDHC card which are much lighter, cheaper and faster than the old CF card which some other SLR's require. It has a decent battery life (400-500 shots per charge).From 12 modes on the dial, 7 modes are called Basic modes which have auto settings. Depending on the mode you select from it the camera will select the best settings for you, so that you just point and shoot. The other 5 modes are for creative photography where you can tweak different camera settings (metering, white balance, shutter speed, flash etc.) to suit the image. In these 5 modes you can also use the live-view, so that you click pictures looking at the LCD-screen (with 5X or 10X zoom).Another fact you should seriously consider if you're a beginner to the SLR photography: Canon Rebel XS has a 7-point AF system, compared to 3-point AF in Nikon D40/D60. A point focus system gives you the option to select a specific area in the whole frame to focus, it's especially useful when you're taking a Macro pictures and want to create a sharp image of the area/object you select by AF and a good blur (Bokeh) on the surrounding parts of the frame. Even though a 7-point AF in Rebel XS is lesser than a 9-point AF in SONY A200K, it still comes out better than SONY when you count other features in the Rebel XS. There is so much more scope for being creative using this camera.Many people have made a huge hue-n-cry that the Rebel XS does not having a spot metering. But in my use I still haven't found the desperate need of it. The Rebel XS has "partial metering' which reads approx. 10% of the viewfinder at center and you can recompose the image to your liking by adjusting the aperture setting and shutter speed in Manual mode, if necessary.If you are considering photography as a serious hobby then I suggest you to consider this camera. Once you get this camera you should start saving money to buy good Macro, Ultra-wide and Telephoto zoom lens then  you will see what wonders this camera can do. In addition, Canon has a large collection of SLR lens that you can choose to fit this camera. So, for a price range between $450-470 this camera is a steal!But if you're still in doubt, then please read the complete review at: [...] and also go to the nearest Best Buy or local camera store to compare the performance of Canon Rebel XS with Nikon D40/D60, Olympus E-420, Pentax K200D and SONY A200K.One accessory I would recommend is the Canon XS/XSI Digital Rebel Kit with Case, 58mm UV Filter and LP-E5 Li-ion Battery

Reviews.Title: A great camera for the price. You need a DSLR.
Reviews.Author: Tom B.
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great camera for the money. It offers affordability, function, and great shots at a wonderful price point. For a bit more than a full featured point-and-shoot, you can get an equally full featured DSLR.This camera offers ease of use for beginners to the SLR market but also has a full feature set that even experienced photogs would love to have.I'm not going to get into all the features here, you can read them above on Amazon's product page, but I will tell you that they are there to help you get the most of your shot. You can, of course, control exposure, shutter, and aperture, but you can also control white balance and color modes with a push of a button.At high ISO speeds you can shoot indoors without a flash, your pictures will turn out beautiful and perfect every time.  What once you would need a 80a or a neutral density filter for you can now do with a few brief menu options on the camera.Another great feature is the live view feature where you can use the LCD screen to see what the camera sees. This is so you won't have to look through the viewfinder and especially useful when doing tripod work.Also the EF-S mount on this camera will also accept your older EF lenses, though EF-S lenses won't fit on your EF mount camera.Overall this is a great camera. It offers wonderful features, price, and takes great pictures.  So why don't you move up to a DSLR and start taking great pictures instead of just good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic deal!
Reviews.Author: Kathryn
Reviews.Content: I really lucked out with this purchase. I don't think I'll ever find a deal as good as this again. Thanks a bunch! I've been having a blast taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Just love my Rebel
Reviews.Author: Curlz
Reviews.Content: I really love the ease of use, the quality and the software.  Make me look professional and there is a wealth of online specialized help with Canon.Would be nice if it had come with video quality.Now I hear I can upload to the cloud; that will be my next Canon.

Reviews.Title: Wish It Had Video
Reviews.Author: J. Young "JNY"
Reviews.Content: Literally, that is my only complaint. This was a phenomenal starter DSLR and would recommend this to anyone looking to get into the DSLR world (especially for the price). I've used some friends' Canon and Nikon DSLRs in the 18MP range with both 18-55MM & 75-300MM lenses and while you'll notice a huge difference with the lenses, the difference in most of the photos for normal person size usage (computer screens, mobile devices, big screen televisions, uploading to facebook, etc.) is negligible. I'll keep this until it dies.

Reviews.Title: the rebel
Reviews.Author: dmcqueen
Reviews.Content: I've had my camera for bout 2yrs now and i absolutely love this camera.the functions are easy and really i think this is a good beginner camera for any new SLR camera user. and i would definitely recommend this to any photographer lovers of course I'm sure the pro's have some better camera's then this one but it's definitely a good camera beginner or not. i also bought a 50mm-300mm lens which is an excellent lens for getting some far shots on clear night i get excellent shots of the moon.

Reviews.Title: Good camera. Better ones out there.
Reviews.Author: KRO16
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera with a few drawbacks. Do not get this if you want to take very mobile photos (concerts etc.) as it is fairly large. It is noisy. The picture quality is really high if you know what you're doing and there are many accessories you can buy. The item was delivered on time and in good condition.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: gmurf
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera used to take my daughter's Senior pictures and Graduation ceremony. I needed to get it in less than 5 days in order to be able to use it. I emailed the member I bought it from, and was assured it should make it in time. It came promptly as promised. The camera has been a great investment and works perfectly. My daughter's photo's are beautiful. I have nothing but good things to say about this camera and the seller.

Reviews.Title: Fast delivery, Product in Great Condition
Reviews.Author: Brad Hickey "HappilyReformed"
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Canon Rebel XS 10.1 MP Digital SLR Camera because I was tired of the uneven success that I had with other, cheaper cameras. I received my product quickly and all promised components were in the box as described. I have spent a week with this camera and I was delighted with all the features as well as the clean, clear shots that I have been getting as I take pictures of family or at youth events every Sunday. I couldn't be happier - its a great camera at a reasonable price for the SLR side of photography.

Reviews.Title: Hooray for my first Canon DSLR
Reviews.Author: MegWill
Reviews.Content: I had to say I was a little wary. I don't like buying electronics online because I don't know if I can trust the sender and what the product is. However I was extremely pleased with this. It said used, but it came in an unopened box, with all of its original sealing in tact. It arrived in a timely manner and works perfectly. It is now one of my most prized possessions. I take it everywhere with me. The price was great as well. I am very pleased with my experience.

Reviews.Title: Truly Amazing
Reviews.Author: Ruben
Reviews.Content: This is awesome experience having this DSLR as beginner. I bought it on 2010 December and still it is working fine. I didn't notice any issue till now. Picture quality is also above the expectation. I will recommend this camera for everyone who are new to SLR world. In short good camera at good price.

Reviews.Title: Great Beginner DSLR Camera
Reviews.Author: Rebel Shooter
Reviews.Content: This camera was my first step into the DSLR world. I have had it for over a year now, taken thousands of pictures, and I am still super happy with my purchase. While I really enjoy shooting with the kit lens, I suggest getting a 55-250mm telephoto lens as a second lens, as it allows you to do so much more with the camera. One day, when I have more money, I plan on upgrading to a newer camera within the Rebel line (probably a T2i) as I now feel I am ready for a more advanced camera; however, I will always keep the XS, as it is such a sturdy, reliable camera.Pros:-Great for the beginner, introduces them to using DSLR-Good picture quality-Durable (mine has been through a lot of hiking, field camps and other rough times)-Light weight-Reliable (never had a single problem with mine)Cons:-Wish it had a few more megapixels (might want to consider XSi 12.1MP if you are looking to do larger prints)

Reviews.Title: fast review
Reviews.Author: Armando
Reviews.Content: Really nice camera,  old but nice, with the correct accessories will be a really good option for amateur photographers.macro photos are so clear, and the weight is just perfect. In the other hand, no video :-l

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Joslyn Brandt
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  Super easy to use for the average consumer but has great manual functions for the more advanced photographer.  Great first DSLR for a kid wanting to learn about photography.

Reviews.Title: Review of Canon Rebel XS SLR camera
Reviews.Author: J. F. Smith
Reviews.Content: Having researched this camera prior to the purchase, I knew what my expectations were.  The Rebel XS has fulfilled these expectations and more.  And the price offerred at Amazon was the best available.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Laxman Narayanan
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing bargain at the price! Easy to use and get used to. A must buy for DSLR beginners.The camera arrived within a day of payment. neatly packed and very safe.Thank you Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Solid Camera!
Reviews.Author: AGnagmeoln
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  I used it for indoor pictures and outdoor with the kit lens.  Pictures looked professional!  Quite an adjustment going from film to a DSLR but it takes much nicer pictures than I expected.The camera feels great in your hands.  Solid neckstrap as well!  Live view is nice when shooting on a tripod but I like the viewfinder much better overall.Getting a new lens, can't wait!

Reviews.Title: Pretty Great Actually.
Reviews.Author: TheCaptain
Reviews.Content: The Canon Rebel XS is a great DSLR. If you are looking for a low cost entry into the EOS line, this is pretty much the way to go. There is a slight learning curve but it's nothing unexpected. The real amazing thing about this are the secondary features that you wouldn't find in most cameras in this price range.Definitely worth it as a first DSLR.

Reviews.Title: The best first DSLR
Reviews.Author: FanOfAmazon
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. This is my first DSLR and I am very happy with every aspect of the camera. A huge difference from all the point and shoot cameras in terms of the image quality. One word to describe the images - AWESOME !!So if you are looking to buy your first DSLR, this one is definitely my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: Canon rebel xs with 2 lens
Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: I ordered the canon rebel xs based on all the positive reviews.  I am very pleased with my purchase.  I wanted a SLR camera that would be good for a beginner and this camera is perfect.  The image qualility is superior. I also purchased the canon 55mm-250mm lens.  The total price from amazon,for camera, a 18mm-55mm IS lens, and 55mm-250mm IS lens was the best around, $545.00 total. This camera takes very impressive photos.  I have not found anything I do not like about this camera and lens.  I have had this camera for apx 1 month and am very pleased!  The instuction book is simple to understand also.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera
Reviews.Author: Russell C. Westover "R Westover"
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Canon Rebel and it is exactly what I expected.  I get great shots day or night.  It does not have some features of a professional model, but it is within my price range and does everything I need.

Reviews.Title: Good for Beginners
Reviews.Author: Vamsi
Reviews.Content: I bought this a month back! and I am just loving it! Firstly I will have to say that this camera is best for people who want to try a DSLR for first time ( with decent budget) ;)The Auto mode works just fine, but I felt that it's of no use when clicking photographs in low light. But good enough!I've been using the macro mode, semi-automatic modes ( TV and AV).. it gave me awesome results..I've also liked the RAW images, and it was just fine ... I didn't find speed of clicking pics an issue ( as others commented )..This is my latest work with this camera: [...]( a mix of RAW and direct shots )You will have to see this to believe me :D ( I am not a pro .. not at all )I've used this camera with canon standard IS lens and Canon EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6 IS Telephoto Zoom Lens .. and I couldn't be more happier with the results..I've tried AF Servo Focus just a bit but It didn't give me that satisfactory result ( probably I need to tweak things a bit more )There's lot more to explore.. but my initial review is all ***** for this instrument..

Reviews.Title: Great camera and great service
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Hard
Reviews.Content: My son loves his new camera and took tons of photos of Christmas with the family!Great camera and great service...thanks!

Reviews.Title: You don't have to be a professional to take beautiful photos with this camera
Reviews.Author: T. Rickbeil "neoncandle"
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a SLR camera once our toddler son got too fast for the point-and-clicks.  I wonder why I waited so long.  I love this camera.  The pictures are stunning.  The prices have really come down.  This would be a great gift to a newly married couple, new mom or techie.However, if price is not that big of an issue, I might go with one of the Ti models since they do HD video. One other issue with it is that it is very bulky.  Most SLRs are, but the trend is that they are going to get smaller.Still, for this price, I'd jump in.  I'm very satisfied with my purchase one year later.

Reviews.Title: My wife loves the camera
Reviews.Author: RainMkr
Reviews.Content: Everyone else has pretty much said it all, but I wanted to say we used it for two solid days and my wife loves it. There was no need to buy an upgraded model or more expensive because this camera for the amiture is more than enough. Tried the extra lense that came with it and it did great as well. 5 stars for sure.

Reviews.Title: sure beats my point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Marvin C. Latimer "Mel'sbells"
Reviews.Content: I have a point and shoot that films HD video so I didn't need it in a slr.  The P&S; is always in  my pocket when I am taking pictures. Years ago I had a Canon TX and an AE1 film cameras, but got away from it.  Got my first digital camera about 6 years ago and finally got to the point I wanted to do somethings a pocket camera can't do.  I'm very happy with the  xs and the 4 lenses I now have for it.  A little more work than the little pocket gem, but a lot more fun in the long run.

Reviews.Title: New to photography
Reviews.Author: Michael J Sbalchiero
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a class that I am taking.  As a first time DSLR user, I find the controls and UI to be very easy to work with.  The pictures that I have taken have turned out very well and get better with more experience.  The only problems I am having with the photographs are RAW image support, although this is more a problem with finding compatible software than with the functionality of the camera.While the included Canon software does handle the RAW images, it does not have the functionality that is necessary for digital darkroom photo processing.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: R. Hamilton
Reviews.Content: I have been using cheaper cameras for years with poor results but this is great for the money. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: BATTERY ISSUES
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "mscherokee"
Reviews.Content: I've had my Canon XS for several months now, and just starting taking photography classes, to help me better understand all the bells and whistles of photography.  One problem I've run across is the battery life.  I have the original battery and after fully charging it, there are only three lines of battery life when I put it in my camera.  I was told by a "expert" battery distributer, the problem might be my camera.  I brought a replacement battery with the same results.  Does anyone have any ideas, why??  Any suggestions will be very helpful. Otherwise, I am pleased with my camera...UPDATE: 8/24/10SO....since I posted, I actually took my battery and camera in tow, to have an EXPERT look at it.  And lo and behold, the battery is fine, I was looking at the wrong....sorry for the 4-stars......if I could change it 5-stars all the way for my Rebel Cannon XS.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: The Phantom
Reviews.Content: For as many reviews as there are for this camera, there isn't a lot that I can add. The only feature that perplexes me a bit is the inability to "erase all" by using the delete button. Other models allow for this but for some reason, using the delete button gives you the option of deleting only one picture at a time.

Reviews.Title: Works GREAT!
Reviews.Author: B. Sharnick "B. Sharnick"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I would recommend it to anyone. It is professional quality and MACRO pictures come out great. There are also MANY, MANY Accessories and different kits you can buy for accessories. The best camera I have ever used. Also its great quality and amazing design.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great camera, specially considering the price. Some say that this is harder to use than the Nikon D3000, but it took me just 5 minutes and some 20 pics to get used to the manual controls. After that, you get really good quality image, sharp pictures, and very good results in low light.Some tips: forget about the live view, it's just useless. Avoid using high iso modes, since it makes a lot of noise for values over 400 (but this is just like any other camera within this price range). Be really carefull when using the manual focus mode, because there will be a lot of pictures that will look great in the lcd screen, but on bigger screen will look totally out of focus.Over all, it's a great camera, and after trying a friend's Nikon D3000, I think this is the best choice if you are looking for "my first dslr", just like I was two months ago.

Reviews.Title: Good beginning SLR Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Ritter "Danny Joe"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for several months and really enjoy it.  The only downfall I can see is the flash unit on the camera.  A friend allowed me to use his attachable flash and what a difference.  Other than that it takes great pictures nad is fairly easy to use even for beginners like me.

Reviews.Title: An affordable DSLR
Reviews.Author: Joshua D. Spurgeon "--Joshua S."
Reviews.Content: I like this camera a lot.  Great pictures and very fast response.  Up to 3 pictures a second and only a split second start-up time even after recovering from sleep mode.

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR - I love it
Reviews.Author: Sean P. Moran "spmoran"
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR camera. I am a relative novice, so I will not try to convince of of anything technical. I will just say that I really like this camera. I took advantage of the deal Amazon has on the zoom lens, and I also bought a 50mm prime. So far these are all I have needed. The images this camera creates are great. The camera takes a little figuring out, but it is pretty powerful. High ISO noise isn't bad at all. I am very satisfied with this camera and the deal at Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: A. Vo
Reviews.Content: I went from a Canon A-1 to this, and haven't looked back!  The greatest feature of this camera:  It's fun to use!  I guess this is a common feature to all digital cameras.  You are able to see your picture right away, and make exposure corrections as needed for that perfect picture.  This encourages you to take more pictures, and instantly learn from your mistakes.  I am not a professional photographer, but for my money, this camera is hard to beat.  I still keep my trusty A-1 at home, but this Rebel XS is the one that I'm driving around town with these days.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR for starters
Reviews.Author: Renan Wug Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Great DLSR for starters in photography. Great image quality, great battery life, the controls are all so easy to use. The only thing is that the max ISO speed is 1600, I personally think it could be more, maybe 3200....Other than that, the Rebel XS is the perfect DSLR for me.

Reviews.Title: Great Entry Camera from someone that wants more than a Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Meachell13
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year ago from Amazon and have absolutely loved using it.  I was able to learn a lot about the creativity modes on this camera but for those of you that don't have a big interest in learning this, if still comes with the different auto settings that all Point and Shoot cameras come with.  I think that this would be a great gift for someone that is wanting to learn photography without a huge price tag.  Then they can always upgrade later on if and when they out grow this one.  Canon's Rebel line has been pretty awesome on adding features that the prosumer's cameras have but without the big price tag.  So save yourself a little money and get a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great value
