Reviews.Author: M. B. Jackson "Mike J."
Reviews.Content: This is one great camera!  You will not find a better SLR camera for the money.  I just started playing in the world of SLR's and what a great camera to start learning on.  I've already had many people who have seen my photographs tell me that they look like they were shot by a professional.  This camera was also shipped to me really fast and I could not find it cheaper anywhere else!Mike

Reviews.Title: Perfect entry-lever dslr
Reviews.Author: Timm
Reviews.Content: My first digital slr.  Love it.  Used to have a film Rebel G, so the learning curve on this one was pretty easy for me.  I'm  sure there are a million arguments for stepping up to the next dlsr in line, but I didn't see a reason for it.  This is a MUCH better camera than the one I was replacing, so all the nitpicky little drawbacks ("only" 7 autofocus points, "only" 1.5 fps in raw, etc.) seem silly to me because they completely blow away my other cameras.  I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: First DSLR
Reviews.Author: Eugen
Reviews.Content: As my first DSLR, I found Rebel XS very easy to use. After couple of weeks of "playing" with it I was able to use almost all advanced features. I'm no longer using the preset modes.I've noticed some difficulties with AF at low light, but, hey, you can always focus manual and for only $ 450.... very good DSLR for the price. Great image.I would upgrade the kit lens with something with a wider aperture for low light pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great beginner camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Rockwell "Interweb Prowler"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my mom to begin learning photography.  I bought this a few days before Christmas and Amazon had it delivered on time with no problems.  I may have waited to purchase a better camera for the price, but this one fit the bill and the time frame!  As for the XS it works well, with all of the drawbacks and perks of a entry level DSLR.This model is beginning to become obsolete with later models filling its spot.  However if you decide to pick one up you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Step Up
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Vedomske "mvedomske"
Reviews.Content: This is our first step leaving the point and shoot world.  We were pretty worried about making the transition, as neither my wife nor I have any DSLR experience.  However, just the automatic settings on this camera make your pictures look phenomenal.  We are still exploring the manual features but the auto features alone make it worth the purchase.  We highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Starter For SLR Newbies!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I am completely new to DSLR. I picked up the Canon EOS Rebel XS kit on a whim because I wanted to start taking much better pictures than what I'm used to taking on a point-and-shoot. So far I am not disappointed. Originally I was going to pick up a Nikon Coolpix L100 10MP Digital Camera with 15x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom but after reading many bad reviews and considering it was just a glorified point-and-shoot with a zoom lens I decided to go all in on the Canon. Auto Mode is a great starting point on this camera, I'm still learning everything about this camera before I get into taking high end pics. If you want to start taking better pictures and are new to the DSLR game this camera is a great starting point- highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Paul Ross
Reviews.Content: This camera is overall excellent - great for the beginner photographer but enough advanced features for the more experienced.  My only complaint is that the plastic body and knobs have a sort of cheap feel to them.  Photo quality is excellent.  Does not come with any memory flash card.  Battery life is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice for 1st digital camera
Reviews.Author: Qookie Queen
Reviews.Content: I finally took the plunge into the digital age and bought this Canon.  I've several lenses from my older SLR Rebels and liked that they would work with this camera body.  This camera is a perfect introduction to digital photography.The automatic modes almost do everything for you and pictures turn out great.  The pictures I've taken so far in Manual have come out beautifully as well and there are plenty of options in the manual modes for experimentation; my favorite is the sepia and b/w filters.  It's been able to take pictures in lower light settings without a tripod than I'm used to with film SLRs; the only drawback I haven't figured out yet is that it seems to lighten the scene (spread the available light?) over the entire picture at times more than I would like for some shots. I haven't played around much with the metering though so that might be the fix.Thanks to my old computer, I did need the included software to download my pics to my PC.  The pictures came out sharp with great color (even with the kit lens) and none of the dirt specks of film.I do wish I had purchased a lens strap; I finally lost the cap somewhere in Las Vegas after four months of use.  I haven't snagged another one yet from my other Canon kits, but one will probably fit since the ring size is the same.  And I'll get a strap this time.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Budget SLR
Reviews.Author: E. DEUGARTE
Reviews.Content: I've owned the XS for a year now and continue to be amazed. I loved this camera from the word go, but as time goes on I am learning how to get the most out its limitations. First off I upgraded the lens. The kit lens is surprisingly good and light weight, but I prefer the 17-40 f4.0 L. Shooting RAW gives you a lot of flexibility if you are processing in Lightroom or Photoshop, especially with the poor light balance performance (incandescent light is yellow). The body is small and compact, too small for my large hands, so I augmented it with a battery pack. This made a huge difference and provided extra stability. I also recommend an upgrade to the onboard flash. The 430EX II speedlite is a great fix to that. Spend your money on good lenses, this camera is great starter if you are accustomed to fully manual film SLRs, as I am.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Amazing!!!
Reviews.Author: Rainy Storm
Reviews.Content: First please note, this is a low-end DSLR, which means it's not for Pros. This is my first DSLR, got it for a month. The image quality definitely pops. I've been mostly using the full auto mode and they already look amazing. it has plenty of manual controls. A few things that are slightly disappointing are that the ISO only goes up to 1600 and my point-and-shoot type camera goes up to 3200, and it does not shoot video of any kind (the new rebel shoots 1080p video, it's about twice the price of this one). But after seeing the improvement in image quality, it is all worth it! I can take a picture of a random thing around the house and it looks better than real life!Pros:-Price (only about $100 more than a high-end point-and-shoot)-Picture Quality-Shooting speed (no more waiting between pictures!)-Battery Life (only charged it once so far, still no need to recharge yet. I've taken about 300 pictures, about 25% of them with flash, and that includes an 1-hr shooting session on the beach without turning off the camera)-All the manual control a beginner needs-OSD (clear on screen display you can virtually start without reading the manual)-Live-view helps taking pictures at an angle or position you cannot look into the viewfinder (though some shortcoming associated with it, read 'cons')Cons: (which are all compensated with the low price!)-NO video capture of any kind-Live-view isn't what I thought it was (I thought it was like a point-and-shoot style digital camera's display, but if you're using autofocus, you will need to focus with live-view OFF and then turn on live-view, because with it on, the camera loses its autofocus function)Bottom Line: If you love photography and is a beginner and you don't care about video capturing, don't think, buy the Rebel XS kit!!!

Reviews.Title: First DSLR
Reviews.Author: Mark Hampton
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic improvement over the features and functionality in a Canon PowerShot SX20IS we originally tried. My wife was a film photography enthusiast while in Art school and she really enjoyed getting her hands back into the field with this very entry level DSLR camera. Initially, we were really impressed with the camera. It feels solid, the controls felt good, the image quality was fantastic, though the kit lens leaves a lot to be desired. As we got more experience taking photos and learning the controls and effects of different settings, we became disenchanted with the review screen on the back of the camera. There's nothing wrong with the screen for most uses, but there were multiple shots that looked well focused on the review screen (due to it 230k pixel resolution and 2.5" size) but were in fact slightly out of focus. We decided to make a switch to the Rebel T1i that has a review screen of 3" with almost 4x the resolution. We found no issues in using a 10 MP camera as this image size is more than sufficient for most Prosumers or Amateurs. My wife was also frustrated (though I don't think there's a remedy for this) that the viewfinder only shows 95% of the actual image. She has a fantastic eye for framing shots and gets it looking just right in the viewfinder only to find that when it's downloaded to the computer, there's a little something extra in the shot that wasn't visible in the viewfinder. As I checked the full lineup of Canon cameras, this seems to be the nature of the DSLR world. While we did understand that the LiveView screen shows exactly what the sensor gets, my wife is old school viewfinder and the AF doesn't work as nicely in LiveView.I would recommend that if you want any sort of zoom functionality beyond maybe 2x, that you purchase the camera body only and invest the difference in a good quality zoom lens.For regular 50 mm type shots, we found the Canon EF 50 mm f/1.8 II lens to be a great price with a great aperture range. My wife despises the look imposed on a photo by a flash, so a lens with 1.8 aperture allowed her to take indoor shots of family events in really crummy light that turned out great.I would strongly recommend this product for beginning photography students and for anyone that wants more than a point and shoot, but doesn't want to spring the extra $200-$1000 for the next few entries in the canon line of budget dslr.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Heather L. Richard
Reviews.Content: I was going back and forth whether to purchase a DSLR camera that is more than a point n shoot as a non professional and I absolutely love this camera. I wanted a camera that I can take pictures of my baby and not miss that smile. The point n shoots are too slow and I have no pictures of her smiling- well I can not say that any longer- I am able to capture all the smiles. The camera handles wonderful and I have no complaints. I bought this camera on a special day from Amazon and was able to save more money. I would recommend this camera to anyone that wants to move away from the point n shoot and be able to capture all the important memories.

Reviews.Title: Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: J. Dugdale "JD"
Reviews.Content: Received the camera on time, it is a great camera and is easy to use. It has taken some great action shots and still shots. the only down fall is taking pictues in the dark. Even with the flash pics don't come out, a seperate flash stand fixture would be needed but how often do you take pictures is extreme low light. I also wish this was able to record vidoes. Other than that, this is a fantastic camera saved over 50 bucks going through Amazon, it has take some great shots and I highly recomend this camera to anyone. There are other web sites that were much cheaper but are scams. They try to sell you insurance and other items that are not needed Amazon is the way to go. The product is what it is and no false advertizments.JD

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice for PS to DSLR converts
Reviews.Author: S. Saxon
Reviews.Content: I have had my Rebel 1000D XS for a few months now and have fallen in love with it. I have been a great photo enthusiast for a long time now (20yrs.) and felt it time to take it serious. I'm sure that I will be upgrading in the near future but not because this camera cannot do the job. It has a great list of features and I have had no problems with it at all. I purchased it new and shortly afterwards have purchased a 55-250 IS lens for it and now my field of use has widened. There is a few things that I'm sure could have been different on this model such as more AF points and the rubberized coating but for the price it's a great bargain. I have since my purchase become a semi-pro photographer working for a friend and her company photographing daycare's and some other get togethers. I work part-time now for her and I simply love the fact that it has turned into something that I love and can make money at. It don't get any better than that. sid

Reviews.Title: Nice performance, excelent image quality, short Zoom with the default lent
Reviews.Author: John A. Jaramillo "JA"
Reviews.Content: I buyed this camera for my wife. She is a professional photografer and she loves it. She really likes the image quality, the features and the weight. The night and the low light images are great. We think the Zoom with the default lent is so short. We had to buy a new lent for the long-distance images.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Shahin Munshi "iamshahin"
Reviews.Content: It takes a little time to learn how to perfect my pictures but honestly I loved even the very first pictures I took.  I recommend this camera to all the new couples and new mommies and daddies because recording every moment should be done the right way.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I've ever had
Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: I could not ask for a more perfect camera, I was even able to get my husband to use it (he never takes pictures) We bought the Canon Rebel XS 10.1MP Digital SLR Camera with EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Lens (Black) with an extra battery,while on vacation, & it quickly took the place of our digital Kodak cameras.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: E. Okocha "shopaholic"
Reviews.Content: Love, Love, Love this camera. Can't believe the quality , it is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Kristina M. Blakla "Kristina"
Reviews.Content: I recently upgraded to the Canon Rebel XS from a Canon 35 mm camera, and I love it. The picture quality is amazing, and the camera works well with my 5 year old telephoto lens. I would highly recommend this camera for those who are just starting out, or would like to learn more about photography. It's been my hobby for many years, and now that I have a digital camera I can experiment more with the manual settings (experimenting with a film camera can get quite expensive!).My only objection is the live view mode - it only works when you are in the creative modes, not the automatic settings. This is not a huge deal, as you just look through the view finder. I do like to see on the LCD screen the picture as I'm getting ready to take it, but again, this is minor in comparison to all the wonderful features of this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: W. Ernst
Reviews.Content: I've used this camera for several months now and do not have any complaints.  It is lightweight and easy to use.  Picture quality is superb.

Reviews.Title: Excellent One
Reviews.Author: GM
Reviews.Content: I am new to DSLR world and this is my first SLR camera. It is amazingly good :). I bought it because I was planning for a cruise to Alaska and the buy was worth it. Took around 1000 photos and they all turned well. The 'basic-options' are really simple to use and with some minimum 'users manual' reading you will be a pro with the advanced-options. I found the buttons very easy to use. I got the best price at Amazon and also got the prime shipping benefit :).The battery lasted for 3-4 days during the cruise with a single charge, even after continuously using it.You get so many lens options with Canon which is another good thing.I didnt find any issue with this camera and I would recommend it to all beginners.

Reviews.Title: For a Newbie, It's Worth Every Penny!
Reviews.Author: Donnita C. Fowlkes
Reviews.Content: I agonized for months about getting this camera, the Rebel XSi or just getting another point and shoot.  I have never used a DSLR and was afraid that it would be too complicated.  However, I can honestly say purchasing this camera was the best decision I've made.  After doing some research, the XSi was not very different from the XS.  In past reviews a lot people said get the XSi but at the time, the price difference was nominal.  Now that the XSi is about $150 more than the XS, purchasing the XS was a reasonable choice.  I highly recommend this camera if you are new to DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I was starting to get interested in photography and I got it within a few days with expedited shipping. This camera takes great pictures without flash. With the flash, the shutter speed is astounding! It also takes very detailed photos. All my photos turn out great on the computer and on paper. If you are just looking for a point and shoot and are not that serious, don't get this camera. But if you are really interested in photography, this is a great beginning camera!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality Camera for the $$$
Reviews.Author: R. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: The XS is an excellent quality camera for the price (I paid $477.44).  But read the fine print because you may be sacrificing a feature that is really important to you.  Here is what you are sacrificing for a substantial price reduction: 1) video, 2) a slightly larger screen, 3) spot metering, 4) no IR sensor (so you can't use a wireless remote), 5) a nicer grip.  To me those things weren't that big of a deal, and I was better served putting the $$$ into buying lenses, etc.Do not take for granted the lens that is included in this kit.  Very useful.

Reviews.Title: Excellent beginners' SLR camera
Reviews.Author: Avinash R. Shenoy
Reviews.Content: I looked at a lot of cameras before I decided to buy a Canon. (Major reason for sticking to Canon was that I have a great point-n-shoot from them, SD800 IS). I've had it for 5 months now and have found it light enough and easy to use. The picture quality is of course excellent. I  take pictures in RAW format and export them as Tiff after retouching them using the bundled software, which I have to say is quite good. LiveView is useful only for novices or when you let someone less experienced take pictures using your SLR as most people these days find it difficult to use the viewfinder. The only thing that still bugs me that my (somewhat long) nose touches the screen when I take pictures and that kinda makes the screen oily! Otherwise this is a great and cheap body and I will spend more on lenses later. I bought a UV and CP filter from Tiffen and so far am very pleased with my buy!

Reviews.Title: Great camera but only great when you get used to its AF
Reviews.Author: Khoi Dang
Reviews.Content: I've read thru' many reviews about rebel XS and see tons of people have troubles with error 99 and its auto focus system. Mine doesn't have these.I've played with this for a while, with kit lens , of course ...For its auto mode ( basic zone ), I shot 1000 photos in various condition and was able to archive the ratio 90% success which means only 100 photos were deleted due to blur, under/overexpose or out of focus. No dout that rebel XS has a strong auto mode, a nice start for newbie like me. And sometimes, the pro may say : Trust your camera couldn't hurt. The only annoying thing I had is its auto focusing but it happened with first 200 photos before I can get used to it. I know you can do the same. Don't just blame the camera.

Reviews.Title: Whatta buy!!!!
Reviews.Author: D. McNally "Photohead"
Reviews.Content: I really wnted a digital camera that would be good for a beginner and wouldn't have to be abandoned as my skill set grew, and this is it.  It is simple to understand and use right out of the box and even easier to learn to use more efficiently.  I've already added and extra lens to get even more out of it.  I've priced this camera through several other sources, both online and off, and I've yet to find anywhere that offers a better price for the whole package.  I recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Value and Quality is Pervasive in this Camera
Reviews.Author: Edgar P Rutten
Reviews.Content: Feature packed with great image quality make this a great choice for those moving to a DSLR from Point and Shoot. Durability will be tested over time but looks good so far. Also, don't underestimate the wide variety of accessories offered.

Reviews.Title: Excellent SLR
Reviews.Author: John Lieu
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect SLR Camera for those who are not professional. I had a lot of excellent pictures taken  from it in my winter vacation.

Reviews.Title: Thrilled
Reviews.Author: Deborah McCandless
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital slr camera purchase. Many years ago I used to use a 35mm film camera. After using a point and shoot digital camera, I decided to upgrade to a slr. I read lots of reviews and went back and forth between purchasing the rebel xs or the xsi. So far I am glad I went for the xs. I have been using the camera for a month and it seems to have everything that I need. The photo quality was my priority for a budget camera and the xs delivers. I am a small female and the camera seems to fit just fine in my hand. The button placements were awkward at first for me but have gotten a lot more comfortable with them. The live view seems dark and just not very useful to me except on a rare occasion. All in all, I think this camera meets the needs of those that don't want to or can't spend a lot of money, but want excellent photographic results.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: David B. Lawrence "woodworker amature"
Reviews.Content: I have only had the camera about a week.  However, the controls are easy to use.  The camera is well built.  It is easy to handle.  One major disappointment is the live view option. One should be forewarned that taking pictures through live view slows the camera action greatly. This makes taking pictures through the live view impractical.  For this reason, I would have liked the viewfinder to be slightly larger.  Overall, I like the camera. Canon Rebel XS 10.1MP Digital SLR Camera with EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Lens (Black)

Reviews.Title: Old Canon / New Canon
Reviews.Author: Proud AE-1 Owner
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my Daughter as a Christmas present. She wanted a digital SLR because she believed she would have more creative latitude with a changeable lens and wanted the 10+ MP. I bought this particular camera because I had reviewed the Canon manual for this model on line before I decided on a manufacture brand and was instantly reminded why I am biased towards Canon; ease of use, intuitive to understand, competitive price and reliable (well, we will see). I had a Canon AE-1 that lasted over twenty-five years with very few problems. Hope this one gives us the same joy and reliability. Ordering and delivery was fast and uneventful, just what I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Combination
Reviews.Author: Laura M. Weeks "Techcheck"
Reviews.Content: I got this last month and have been using it for the past month, and it has worked just like it was supposed to.  the lens it comes with is great for landscape pictures, but i recommend a lens like the Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III USM Telephoto Zoom Lens for Canon SLR Cameras for sports and artistic photography. Overall, great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR since the days of film and the AE1. I owned various Canon point-and-shoot models and it was time for an upgrade. After many weeks of researched, I decided to go with the XS model and I am sooo glad I did. My other options was the XSi or the Nikon D60. However, the features and price Won me over.This is an excellent camera for beginners as well as advance photographers. It is easy to learn and the photo quality and saturation are just perfect.Go out buy it and shoot, shoot, shoot!

Reviews.Title: like a champ
Reviews.Author: Edward Pulaski "Ed"
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased for a trip to Africa and it was well worth the investment.  There were no issues with it and the pictures were great.  The only thing I don't like about it is that you can't change the default settings of some of the features.  If you want to do something like bracketed shots you have to reset it every time you turn it on or change a lens.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a great price! thank you amazon!
Reviews.Author: N. Wawozny
Reviews.Content: Great camera, feels good in my and wife's hand, great pictures and it is really easy to use. After owning 5 point and shoot cameras, transition to Canon Rebel XS was truly a breeze. Ordered it on 21 December and it arrived on the 24th just is time for great pictures at the Christmas dinner table. What else could i ask for.Thank you Amazon and Cameta Camera for offering this camera at such great price! Local Sears had it on sale for $599!

Reviews.Title: Fast Shipping and Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Grussing "Gruss"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera on a Monday night, with the free shipping it came Thursday afternoon.  This is such an awesome upgrade from my 35mm Rebel Ti.  Love at first sight, I would recommend this for anyone looking!

Reviews.Title: A great choice
Reviews.Author: Daniel Escobar "Dane"
Reviews.Content: bought one like this like a month ago, not from amazon, but i think its the best buy you can ever make, it is, as metioned in other review pages, an "entry level DSLR" so don't expect it to work as a 1d, or a 5d mk II, but it is amazing, photo quality is outstanding, accesories variety is incredible, battery life on this camera rules! (it lasts for me for at least 800 or 1000 shots!) and its an easy to use camera, with a nice lcd display, and another thing i've found incredible on this camera is the fact of it turning off automaticaly after 30 seconds as minimun, so, you can have your camera on, with that sleep function working, and it will not reduce battery life, and the fact that turns on in 0.1 seconds (which is true by the way) lets you be ready to take the picture when you need it, how you need it

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a new comer!
Reviews.Author: Natalie
Reviews.Content: This is my first time working with interchangeable lenses, so it would be a big jump from compact digital to an SLR, but it was easy with this beautiful camera! It comes with an 18-55mm lens, which isn't ideal for zoom but perfect for portrait shots, with its f/3.5-5 IS! What I really loved about this camera, was it's excellent stabilizer. I started with a bit of a shaky hand but it wasn't a problem for this great camera! I recommend this camera to anyone interested in starting out with SLRs! Good luck

Reviews.Title: A very good entry level DSLR...
Reviews.Author: Katie Speicher
Reviews.Content: The camera is a very good entry level DSLR.  But it has limitations because it is entry level.  I have since upgraded to a 60D, and the difference is appreciable.  The low light performance of the XS is good with a corresponding 50mm f/1.8 or better, but the ISO performance is lacking.  With higher ISOs, you do get grain that isn't as noticable with other high end cameras.  Also, 3.1 shots per second isn't bad, but it isn't spectacular.As a first DSLR, this is a very good camera for someone to familiarize themselve with ISO, shutter speed, aperture, white balance, etc.  It even does a good job regarding high dynamic range photography.But again, I don't want to oversell the camera, because there are limitations.

Reviews.Title: Fully satisfied
Reviews.Author: Jaime E. Aguilar Gil
Reviews.Content: Great quality + excellent performance + best price. Bought it for a gift and it worked just perfect! Due dates met for delivery and received all accesories as promised. We're completely happy with it. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: my review
Reviews.Author: Rachel I. Waldridge "Brownie/Dixie"
Reviews.Content: i just bought my camera yesterday with the speculation that i have 30 days to return it if i decide that i dont like it. i was trying to decide between getting this one and a nikon d3000. i took my camera (this one - canon) out to a contesting horse show today (barrel racing, etc) to try it out. i am (i think) a decent photographer, except i occationally have a  little blurriness in high action photos, so i wanted to make sure that whichever DSLR i chose would be good at taking fast action as well as still pictures. i must admit, i am sold on this canon! it has done everything i have asked of it wonderfully without blurring. i wasnt to crazy about the 18-55mm lens at first, due to the fact that i have only used zoom lenses thusfar but it did well.  i am planning to get additional lenses when i get some more money, and looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: My canon Rebel
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Carvajal "rcarva2000"
Reviews.Content: My Canons Rebel has broken twice. No lens communicates with the body. So I sent the lens first and it came back supposedly fixed. Two weeks later, kaput! Then I sent it back with the body...and it's on its way back again.Now, look, Canon service is soooooooooooo nice they made it sooooooo easy for me to drop it off and pick it up it has not even sour my humor about the whole ordeal. I would buy Canon again solely based on their service. Real people phone calls, courteous, no questions asked. Just make sure you fill out those darn warranty forms!!!The Rebel is NOT amateour friendly either as they proclaim.... you better know some SLR stuff if not, stick to a pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: Keep firmware up to date or you'll have huge problems
Reviews.Author: shellcanada
Reviews.Content: I have a canon rebel eos xs had it for almost 3 yrs used it almost everyday.I noticed on my last shoot for a family that it was lagging constantly saying busy .....never thought too too much about it WELL I should have because next time went to use it I have nothing at all keeps saying busy in view finder and will not snap a photo at all!! I have nothing on the display screen!! I have checked with a variety of camera shops to fix it and the lowest price was $400 bucks , well I can buy a brand new higher model for a couple hundred more!!! and the xs sells for under $400 now!!! when I did my research seemed like a WHOLE lot of people were having this same problem with this model of canon camera !!! You would think CANON would offer some sort of help but they do not...would I buy another canon well seeming how I have over $1500 bucks of lenses and flashes I kinda have to but it will be a higher model...I received this one as a Christmas gift ,doubt highly Santa will be kind this year..lol....I would suggest making sure your camera firmware is always up to date !!! and check before purchasing a canon rebel eos xs!!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Maximuss
Reviews.Content: What a great camera, very clear pictures with amazing color, easy to use and the software makes the pictures look even better.Downside, doesn't have a video recording option.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Mraz
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 2 weeks ago, giving me time to find out the features and to write a review.First, the lens (kit 18-55mm) Is actually an OKAY lens. I have heard from other reviews that the kit lens is cheasy. I think it lacks some vibrant colors, but the colors actually are pretty nice. The zoom is pretty bad, so I suggest you get the 75-300mm lens If you want to actually get decent, far away shots.The rest of the camera is great: it takes good photos on auto, but I always use manual. I am a beginner and this camera has taught me much about photography without creating boring photos like a point-and-shoot.Short and Sweet: It's great. I was able to save a little on the camera and get an extra lens and great accessories. Actually, this camera is so great that it doesn't even matter buying a better one - all the accessories turn out better than buying a 500d with just a stock lens.

Reviews.Title: Careful....this was recalled!
Reviews.Author: M. Gonzalez "MissMinie"
Reviews.Content: I owned this camera for a good 2 years and change. I loved it forever, but somewhere around the one year mark, out of nowhere mind you, it handed me a generous helping of Error 99. It was all downhill from there. I researched like mad and did EVERYTHING suggested (people suggest some crazy things, but I tried it all) to no avail. I have a hard time blaming a certain brand or model for problems like this, but I must say it was a BIG deal. I am a professional photographer, so to have a camera that has these problems is just unacceptable, and I had to work a LOT harder than ever to save up for my new T3. Which I love.When I went to Walmart on a late-night emergency run (my Error 99 was to the point where I couldn't take photos anymore, and I had a wedding to shoot the next day! For once, thank goodness for Walmart and their crazy hours!)I had every intention of buying another XS to replace mine. Apparently between the time I called and the time I got to the store, it had been pulled off their shelves due to a recall.I searched EVERYWHERE for info on this, and couldn't find a THING.I doubt the woman was lying to me, but I highly recommend you guys do some research into this model and potential risks. I loved loved loved my XS before the errors took over, but I'd have spent more on a better model had I known :(My problems involved Error 99 (where it won't save the photo I just took, and won't do anything else until I remove and re-insert the battery. Also I couldn't turn it on without doing this to the battery first EVERY time I turned it on, otherwise it would give me the error within the first 5 frames).Also, my LCD screen stopped showing in color. Not quite black and white, but mostly. There would randomly be streaks of neon color (not color that belonged in the photo. Just a big pink or green streak across some part of the photo). I couldn't see full color in any photo until it was on my computer, and even then it took about 5-10 seconds to load and become colored. Weirdest thing I've ever seen. And when I went into LiveView, it looked like a crazy heat-sensor camera. You know, neon colors and crazy psychedelic shapes....it was madness.Eventually, my view finder slipped out of place somehow. I could hear something rattling around inside, but the actual viewfinder looked normal until you looked THROUGH it. It looked the way it does when you put on someone else's glasses. Someone who has TERRIBLE vision. No joke, the view finder was useless, live view was useless, I was basically shooting with my instinct. And it worked for about a year! Not that I had a choice of giving upon it, even with all the problems. Doing this for a living meant making it work somehow. And I'm happy it's OVER!So...be careful! I'm sure others have had this camera for over 2 years with NONE of these issues, but I can't have that happen to me and not warn others!Best of luck with whatever you end up with!

Reviews.Title: All I expected and more.
Reviews.Author: William Sun
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur photographer and I bought this camera now that I have a baby so I could take better pictures.I have to say I have only had the camera for 2 days but I am genuinely impressed.If I have any extra comments I will modify my review later on.

Reviews.Title: Good Automatic Camera
Reviews.Author: Mr. Suede
Reviews.Content: I used this and the Sony Alpha 200 and I like the Sony Alpha better.  This camera is good in the auto settings, but you can't change fine details like the Sony.  Also, Sony has Image Stabilization built into the camera, you have to buy more expensive lenses with this camera.  If you are a beginner at digital photography, this is a very good camera.  I do like it, but...

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: do not disturb
Reviews.Content: Everything and more of what I wanted in a Camera. Shutter speed, shutter speed, shutter speed. No more missed or blurred shots, I realy hated my digital camera until I purchased this Canon. I got it for a great price with a telephoto lens to boot. I purchased an external flash unit for it and have really taken a lot of great pictures with it. No more missed shots unless I'm not paying attention. Did I mention shutter speed,shutter speed,shutter speed? I also wanted to mention memory,man can you take a lot of quality pictures with this camera.I haven't taken the time to read the manual or tried taking complicated shots, I'm just having fun again taking great pictures. I was told I would never get a deal on a Canon camera. Amazon blew that thought out of the water and has made a loyal customer out of me. Jim

Reviews.Title: Great entry level! With pro level capabilities
Reviews.Author: Larry L. Sanmiguel "Syntax"
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to make a small review for the average Joe to read, mainly cause I know all the "camera guy" lingo and myself would rather just have a point black "Yes" or "No".So in a word, "Yes". If you're thinking about grabbing this camera, do it, especially with the kit lens, it's a very nice lens for a kit anyway; you'll be able to do a lot with just that lens alone.That's without touching in the camera, it does almost everything it's big brothers can do, with a lower price tag! So yes, buy it, use it, love it.I do.

Reviews.Title: Great camera! Image quality is superb!
Reviews.Author: BabyLuv89 "BabyLuv89"
Reviews.Content: IT'S GREAT! The picture on amazon does it no justice! lol It looks way better in  person. Performs well and has the best picture quality! GET IT! Worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Best camera for amateurs or professionals.
Reviews.Author: Sylvia G. Cullivan "Cat Lover"
Reviews.Content: This camera has changed my opinion of clunky bigger cameras.  I use to think that I did not want to carry that big of a camera.  I always chose the smaller digital pocket ones.  With the small ones I did not get the features I needed or wanted.  This digital Canon Rebel XS has it all and is light weight and so easy to use.  I get high quality photos everytime especially of my cats.  The red eye feature is wonderful as my cats have blue eyes and now I can see that in the photos.  With the smaller pocket ones I always got red eyes even when I set it at that feature.  I highly recommend this digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome starter camera
Reviews.Author: drossa
Reviews.Content: Used this as my first camera and love it and just upgraded to a 70d. If you are just getting started this is a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: barn
Reviews.Content: Although I am not an expert photographer or camera user, the camera takes great pictures even in the auto mode. The battery life is really good - lasts months of light use on one charge.

Reviews.Title: Simply an awesome camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Michael Graves
Reviews.Content: I have been shooting most of my life and I must say this camera rocks big time. With over 200 events now under my belt I still reach for this light weight, simplistic, fast acting camera (I do have access to an incredible choice of glass however), which renders stunning pictures over and over again, especially after tweaking my favorite images in Photoshop. Good job Canon!

Reviews.Title: best chocie
Reviews.Author: gusafro
Reviews.Content: good product woks very well and it have a good quality, good materials and good price i recommend it always

Reviews.Title: Used like new!
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Morris
Reviews.Content: Used? Could have fooled me, this thing feels brand new!  It's a fantastic product at a great price in great condition.

Reviews.Title: Best expensive purchase I've made so far.
Reviews.Author: Erwin Preciado
Reviews.Content: Came in excellent condition like it was described. Even though it was used, the camera and all other accessories looked brand new with very little to no use. It was a great price and I feel comfortable knowing I can trust this seller. After all, this is a camera I will be using for a very long time.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Connor Moriarty
Reviews.Content: Bought used and could not be happier with my first dslr, definitely a little dated, but that does not mean it doesn't take awesome pictures

Reviews.Title: Made a great gift
Reviews.Author: H. W. Fitzgerald, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my granddaughter for her college graduation.  She just loves it and it takes great pictures both indoors and outdoors.

Reviews.Title: My great Canon Rebel
Reviews.Author: Juniebell
Reviews.Content: I love this camera....it's really the kind of camera I needed......not too complicated to operate and still takes great pictures......

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Amber-D
Reviews.Content: Love this I was so happy with the EX bought me this one to replace the old cheap thing hos sister bought this is the one they use at the college too.

Reviews.Title: Very useful camera for starters
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: My wife lives this camera it does almost everything except wifi but hey it suites her. And not only that it's easy to use

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: Outdoors Handyman "DRD"
Reviews.Content: Arrived with a dead battery or charger.  No response from seller.  Had to purchase replacement battery and charger so I could deliver a gift on time.  I've had another one of these cameras and that one came with no flaws.

Reviews.Title: Good product but wish focus was better
Reviews.Author: Mahsoun Choudhury
Reviews.Content: Its a good product for the price though the focus does drop when you zoom in. I use it for outdoor photography and it does bother me when I have to zoom in

Reviews.Title: Great for beginners
Reviews.Author: Gabe Cassini
Reviews.Content: This was my first entry for a Digital SLR.  Previously I was using smaller cameras and could never get the shots in time because the flash took too long of the kids moved.  All I would get is blurry pictures.  This camera has allowed me to capture the shots I used to miss.  I am not an avid photographer so I spend most of my time in auto mode so I cannot comment on the rest of the features.

Reviews.Title: better than described
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: when i bought it it said that it had a little damage on the corner of the lens but wheni got it it had NO damage. I felt like it was brand new I LOVE IT !!! the only thing is that its smells a lot like cigarrette but meh... it will fade away with time100 points to this thank you so much!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: not everything included
Reviews.Author: Art
Reviews.Content: The camera was missing interface cable and video cable. have found it is very diffivult ti obtsinbattery pack and card. best buy does not sell them for this model.

Reviews.Title: Great starter camera
Reviews.Author: P N
Reviews.Content: This is a great starter dslr for anyone wanting to get into photography.There aren't as many features on the the XS but that's good as it helps you build a base for which to start. Interestingly enough the XS has decent low light capabilities since the megapixel count is so low compared to other rebel lined cameras.I wish it had a scroll wheel like higher end models though and used a cf card.

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: Luis Moran
Reviews.Content: Excelente product. Not more to say.We received like it was in the info and picture.thanks a lot.LM

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: monique martinez
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves it. delivery was fast came c strap no lens cover. was just as decribed, this is a perfect starter camera for a teenager

Reviews.Title: Saved up for a year and it was totally worth it
Reviews.Author: Nitika Daga
Reviews.Content: I saved up for a year for this camera (when I was 16) and it was totally worth it. Its was a great price for a starter DSLR and just owning a DSLR totally changes your photography game. I would 100% recommend this as a first DSLR purchase on a budget. Note that the lens is pretty limited and I would suggest augmenting it with another lens with a wider zoom range.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: anereus
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my granddaughter who is a shutterbug. We had to come up with a couple of items, such as a filter and an a storage card. Other than that, it was ready to go.

Reviews.Title: Astrophotography made easy!
Reviews.Author: Jerry M. Hoffman "Michael"
Reviews.Content: I just bought one of these because I needed a camera with more manual options for astrophotography. First time I used it was tonight, I did not feel like reading all the options so I just manually put focus to infinity and left it on full auto exposure. I was amazed at how well it works on full auto for taking pictures of the night sky from my back yard. Very cool!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, user friendly simple to use features. Excellent picture quality
Reviews.Author: Alistair McKay
Reviews.Content: I ordered this slightly used canon rebel XS and I was very impressed. The ease of use and photo taking features are great. Battery life terrific.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Juliano Ribeiro
Reviews.Content: In time, very good quality of the product. It works very well. I don't have any complains about this product.

Reviews.Title: Too much for a beginner
Reviews.Author: T. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I find myself very overwhelmed with this camera. It's my first "Real" camera and there are so many features on it and struggle with trying to figure it all out. I may have to take a class because the book I bought also seems to be more for an advanced user. I end up using the basic stuff on it, so really I could have just bought a nicer, basic camera without all of the bells and whistles on it.

Reviews.Title: Great for a beginner
Reviews.Author: M. Smitherman
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my year away at grad school in London, thinking I'd want to take some high-quality photos of Big Ben and the rest of the London sights while I was living there. I'd only ever had experience with your basic point-and-shoot cameras, and after a bit of research, I decided that this was the camera for me. It definitely suited all my needs! I'm not a photographer by trade, and I had no super high expectations in terms of the results. I just wanted to record my adventures in high quality, with more options than just flash/no flash. What I ended up loving most about this camera was that I could set the exposure time, so long exposure night-time shots of the London Eye and Westminster Abbey turned out to look incredible. I wish I could share some of the photos I took with this camera, because I honestly didn't think I'd be able to crank out such consistently great photos, not being taught in the ways of photography beyond a quick how-to from my photographer dad. If you're looking for an upgrade to a DSLR but you don't want to drop thousands of dollars on a camera you'll never do justice, this is a great option! I love it to death.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera for a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Hansen-Devaux
Reviews.Content: This is just a SLR, only digital. Meaning: this is a fantastic camera to take beautiful pictures easily, or fantastic pictures with a bit of work (manual mode). This is not as easy as a Powershot (duh!) and the manual mixes gadgets and actual useful features indiscriminately but those who know the correlation between aperture and depth of field should find there way in quickly.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: J. Ghandour "JAD MD"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera. Bought it used but looks and feels brand new. Not a single scratch on it. Cant wait to start taking lots of pics with it!

Reviews.Title: rebel
Reviews.Author: bob
Reviews.Content: Carma work's goog but the lens that came with it didn't workso well the auto focus dont work at all has to be manual focused

Reviews.Title: Arrived early, a little funky
Reviews.Author: Devra Torres
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to get it a few days early (you have no idea how excited I was:) but when I assembled it (yes, it comes in separate pieces) I was a little sad to see there was no lens-cap...but then again, it never specifically mentioned one so...My main problem with it was it's quality...quite a few pics have been blurry, and sometimes it doesn't even take the picture! This doesn't happen very often, but when it does....  Someone said that that happens if you get to close (though I was about a foot away) so maybe that was it...Other than that, absolutely stunning and great fun...I haven't stopped snapping photos since it arrived.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: I have already used this camera to take hundreds and hundreds of pictures. The quality is pretty good. No complaints there. Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: takes great pictures
Reviews.Author: C.J. Warrington
Reviews.Content: takes crisp photographs weither it be in studio or outdoors, set up, or point and shoot, this camera is a great buy

Reviews.Title: Best XLR for the Money
Reviews.Author: RobbieAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This camera takes AMAZING photos.  Some of the settings are a little confusing, but if you take the time to read the manual and learn the settings, you'll do fine.  Of course, you can also just leave it on the automatic setting, and it works perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: This doesn't need my review...excellent product by Canon
Reviews.Author: Subhakanta Nanda
Reviews.Content: We were looking for our first SLR and stumbled upon this model. We are delighted. So far no issues with the photos or functions. You will need a telephoto for graduating to those "distant & fine" snapshots.

Reviews.Title: love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Ellie M.
Reviews.Content: I'm a young photographer (14 years old) and this was my first dslr to own. definitely a great camera. easy to work with, produces great images, and isn't terribly big so it's easy to travel with. I've taken it all over the world and am totally impressed with it. I really love this camera and would recommend it to anyone as a first dslr.

Reviews.Title: I bought the camera as Christmas gift for my daughter.
Reviews.Author: Merle Schultz
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived on time as per schedule and in perfect condition.  My daughter loves her camera (it was a Christmas present).  She has a Masters in theatrical costume design and uses her camera for her web site pictures and designs.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Filth and offscouring
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of good reviews for the camera, I bought the canon xs/eos 1000d for my daughters (16&14). They are both aspiring photographers and they love it! I was concerned with the 10.1mp, but the pictures it takes are very crisp and colorful. This has not been an issue for them. It seems that the lack of mp is only an issue if you need to enlarge a picture. The camera is user friendly and not complicated if you are willing to do some reading. The only thing that has been any kind of an issue is the fact that the f stop on the lense only goes down to 5.6, other than that(they can upgrade later), we are pleased with the purchase and would highly recommend this camera for someone trying to get started with a dslr camera.

Reviews.Title: Love My Camera
Reviews.Author: thundra
Reviews.Content: Love my camera, I'm not a die hard photographer but I wanted something beyond a point and shoot. This met all my needs.

Reviews.Author: Astanax Tahlmarine
