Reviews.Title: GREAT DSLR for Beginners
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Henshaw
Reviews.Content: I purchased this DSLR in 2009 as my first "good camera" after learning how to use it in high school digital photography classes. Over the years of owning it, I learned about the camera, the settings and how to use the manual settings properly. I have turned my hobby into a small business and just recently purchased a new camera, but use this as my back up. I still love this camera - very user friendly. I highly recommend this to someone who is looking to start out in the DSLR world!

Reviews.Title: For the price, it is great!
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I am a budding photographer and this is my current body. It was a great introduction into DSLR's and I am happy that I started with a Rebel. Its lightweight which helps when I put a larger lens on. The controls are very intuitive and simply displayed for easy access. This is a great camera to learn with. I was always into photography but never had the chance to work with a DSLR until I got my rebel. I love it! However, if you do have the money, I would suggest moving up to at least an XSi. I love this camera, but for indoor photos (without flash) it can be difficult to work with. The iso at 800 is super grainy which makes indoor photography nearly impossible, but like I said, for the price it is great.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I use it ALL the time. The only drawback is how loud it is (bad for taking pictures of presentations, speeches, or seminars, or anything in a quiet place) and that it's my first DSLR, so it took a while to learn how to use it. I use it at home, at school, for work, for special occasions,...pretty much everything. I take it everywhere with me.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!!!
Reviews.Author: Rebekah Nixon
Reviews.Content: This camera has been with me on both ends of our country and in Mexico and Haiti and has never once failed to meet my expectations. It's not the fanciest, doesn't have all the latest and greatest features, but for a decent, amateur-level DSLR it performs beautifully. Great for a first camera or backup camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy
Reviews.Author: M. Marrott
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my wife over a year ago and have had nothing but great things to say about it. There is no point in buying new if you are going to get the same product for a lesser price refurbished. Excellent buy would recommend this to anyone getting started in photography.

Reviews.Title: Cheese!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jdub
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the money, perfect for someone new to the world of DSLRs.The picture quality on this device is great (especially at high-iso shots) much better than any point and shoot. And the battery life is great on a full charge you can shoot the entire day with no worries. The only real downside to this camera is that there seems to be a little lag time when using the built in flash (the screen will say busy) and the live view option is not really that useful.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Sophia
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing camera and an even greater investment:) When it came in i was worried because it had been used before, but frankly, it looked brand spankin new! and it works wonderfully :)

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: Architecture Student
Reviews.Content: This was my first time buying a camera online and I was extremely nervous, but the camera was in perfect condition, arrived quickly and was exactly what I needed. I am very glad I chose to order it through amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: topper
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything I thought it would be and more. For the price you can't go wrong. Takes great pictures in all conditions.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera at an Awesome Price
Reviews.Author: kfscas
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for my oldest daughter for her photography college course.  She absolutely loves the camera, and I got it for a great deal with Amazon Deal of the Day.  Woot sent it as promised and it arrived in perfect condition.

Reviews.Title: My Canon
Reviews.Author: Donald R. Brimmage
Reviews.Content: This camera is nothing short of amazing.  It does all that I want, from potriat shots to nature shots. It is great in manual mode and stellar in automatic if you are in a hurry.  I cannot imagine another camera now that I have this one.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Leon
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I used mine for two years and it worked perfect all thhe time. I even drop it a couple of times (one time was really bad)! And it still working perfect!I just changed it when i got a new Canon 60D, but only for professional reasons. The Canon Rebel XS is perfect for people who wants to start in the photography field!

Reviews.Title: I am so excited about this camera!
Reviews.Author: Meghan O'Connor
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a Nikon Coolpix that I had just gotten this past December.  I was so unhappy with the Nikon and the picture quality.  This Canon is perfect.  I got this camera to be able to take pictures of my twins boys and so far it has not let me down. Every picture has come out really clear and it so easy to use.  I just wish I got this 7 months ago!

Reviews.Title: completely satisfied
Reviews.Author: Coleen Ruffing
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. I upgraded from a point & shoot and although I do miss the compact size and video capability, this camera takes MUCH better pics. If you are a beginning aspiring photographer or a parent like me who wants to take great pics of their kids, definitely a good choice. I read several online reviews by more advanced photographers, apparently and they complained about the plastic body. It does not feel cheap to me at all. I will be looking forward to buying additional lenses later but for now, this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Joseph Paul Sklar
Reviews.Content: I was ready to move up to a full body size camera and this one for the money is simply amazing.  It is very easy to use and takes wonderful pictures. I like having the rechargeable battery.  Very convenient.  This is a great buy for someone looking to step up from a smaller digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Entry level dSLR
Reviews.Author: Z
Reviews.Content: We were moving up from a decent point and shoot digital camera to get better photo flexibility, particularly at long distances.  Following reviews, and recognizing our price point, we settled on the Canon Rebel XS.  We are entirely pleased.  The camera is easy to use, with excellent photo quality and faithfulness to the real appearance of our subject(s).  We were able to use the sports feature to capture our grandson playing little league baseball, at bat and on the base paths.  It was amazing.  All other modes work equally well.  This is not a drawback, but we do recognize that to capture wildlife, in the wild, because of the distances involved, we will need and intend to buy the comparable telephoto lens.

Reviews.Title: Great beginner DSLR
Reviews.Author: Greg B
Reviews.Content: This camera is a beauty when it comes to introducing beginners into DSLRs. I have owned this camera for about 2 years and never had any problems with it. This camera only makes you more hungry to upgrade your gear once you really get into photography and are looking at full frame cameras. One of the upgrades I would recommend right away is getting a much better and sharper lens. Don't get me wrong, the kit lens will work for couple months. A nifty fifty(50mm) lens, although plastic, will give the user a nice sharp image that one can be proud of. Overall this is a great DSLR and you get the bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Turner
Reviews.Content: I am new to photography and learning a lot, but this camera is so easy to use and takes great photos!

Reviews.Title: Para empezar excelente
Reviews.Author: Francisco Castillo "Francisco Castillo"
Reviews.Content: Para comenzar la fotografía profesional es excelente por el precio, aun que hoy por hoy valdría la pena pagar un poco mas por un modelo con otras aplicaciones como video HD, de resto excelente, con el mantenimiento y cuidado necesario.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS 10.1MP Digital SLR Camera w/ EF-S 18-55 mm
Reviews.Author: Beth McCarter
Reviews.Content: Great camera for starters. Excellent item lots of variety types of settings (Portrait,landscape, sports, close up nighttime, Etc.) for new photographers. It works as described with instant stabilizer.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jared Pratt
Reviews.Content: I have not much to say about this product other than it is a great camera. This is my first, so I have nothing to compare it to, but I give it five stars.

Reviews.Title: Canon products
Reviews.Author: dfauquier "theophilus"
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, this was the best camera for its price anywhere on the market. I had a Canon EOS film camera and loved it, but I wanted a digital camera this tiem. Now I first when digital with a pocket camera, and now I have an equivalent to my old camera but in digital.grace2u

Reviews.Title: Great budget DSLR for learning.
Reviews.Author: ElectraMagnet
Reviews.Content: This fall, I decided I would finally take the dive into the DSLR world.  I'm on a relatively tight budget, so I wanted to stick with a simple body, knowing I'd upgrade the lenses first.  On those terms, the Rebel XS fit the bill perfectly, and I'm quite happy with my choice.  The features are certainly sufficient for someone learning the technical ins-and-outs of photography:  exposure, focusing, depth-of-field, etc.  After a few months, the only feature I REALLY miss is spot-metering.  Other things would be nice (better performance at high ISO speeds, more MPs for cropping, more fps and RAW capacity in burst mode, wireless remote compatibility), but I don't think I need them to learn substantially more about photography.As for the lens... I shot with the kit lens exclusively for the first couple months, but I quickly found the low-light performance too limiting.  I've since added two prime lenses to my collection:  the "Nifty Fifty" 50mm 1.8 (great lens for less than a hundred bucks!), and a 28mm 1.8.  Still, the kit lens is nice when I'm walking around during the day and want the flexibility of a zoom.  It's not as sharp as my primes, and the picture quality isn't as good in general, but it's a decent lens overall until I can upgrade to one of those fancy zooms with a red stripe.  If I had to do it over, I'd probably still get the body + kit lens package.No, the Rebel XS is not a professional-grade DSLR.  But I think it's a great option for those that want to learn on a reasonable budget.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding DSLR with basic feature set
Reviews.Author: Ashok Cheenepalli "Ashok"
Reviews.Content: I was looking out for a DSLR that's relatively easy to operate and light weighted as i was using point and shoot cameras for the last 15 years. Based on my research i figured out that Nikon D 3000 and Canon Rebel XS were the best options available to start with. I went with Rebel XS coz it has some nice features like live mode etc. Personally i like to invest more on lens than investing more for the features. I am loving it.

Reviews.Title: 35mm SLR photography out of the darkroom
Reviews.Author: dlc "dlc"
Reviews.Content: The Rebel XS brings back memories of shooting my 35mm Nikon F2 and FM2 many many years ago without the need to fumble and reel 35mm film in complete darkness. From what I can remember, looking at the grain and detail from my film prints with an Agfa loupe compared to digital images from the Rebel is simply incredible! The detail captured by the Rebel XS is almost frighteningly scary when greatly magnified, especially people's faces.Having used Canon point and shoot A series digital cameras, including the A95 which I felt took spectacular images, the Rebel XS brings photography to a completely higher level. Being on a budget I would never have purchased this SLR except I found it on clearance at W-mart for $350.00 new with the 18-55mm IS kit lens.As a novice I believe DSLRs are so refined today, especially among Nikon and Canon, that only minute differences in image quality can only be revealed through professional analysis. I think for the beginner seeking a DSLR the greatest factor would be price and the need for HD movie mode.PROS:+ Say goodbye to 35mm film touching on the reel, hazardous chemicals, darkrooms, and the need for an enlarger.+ So simple to use that even a child can take photos like a pro.+ Stunning photos out of the box on auto mode, although many manual controls at your disposal just like the old Nikon F and Canon F1's.+ Skin tones, color balance, sharpness, detail, and low light images with higher ISO settings are simply incredible.+ Long battery life+ Fast shooting response.+ Great construction and feel.+ Very sharp Image Stabilized kit lens.+ From searching professional reviews and comparative photo images I believe Canon does have a slight edge with their balance of color, sharpness, and noise suppression over the competition.CONS:- As with all modern electronics the next generation always has something you wish for at the same or lower price.- With the XS being an older model I probably would not have paid more than $350 for it and stepped up to a Nikon D3100 or T series Canon- No HD movie mode.- No spot metering.- Continuous shooting mode could be a little faster, although it has an unlimited buffer that will allow the XS to shoot  without stopping until the SD card is filled.* I actually saw another Rebel XS on clearance at W-mart for $260.00 but found out it had been returned twice, so the deals are certainly out there for this model as of this date.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel 1000D
Reviews.Author: Lawrence L. Lunt
Reviews.Content: Moving from a film 35mm (not used in years) to a point and shoot digital, the Canon EOS is a fun and easy next step. I'm purely an amateur but was looking for a little more control and flexibility than the point and shoot offered. This camera is designed for the novice to start taking pictures immediately by setting the camera functions to automatic. As you get comfortable and experiment you can make manual adjustments to try different shots. It takes all the Canon lenses, (high and low end) so you can build a pretty sophisticated capability if you want. There are probably some functions not available in this camera afforded in higher end models: But for my purposes this camera is a gem.

Reviews.Title: canon rebel xs great beginner digital SLR
Reviews.Author: ppbs
Reviews.Content: This canon camera is a great beginner digital SLR camera. It has great auto features. Anyone can use this camera. It has a great stabilization lens. But it is a Digital SLR, and for its kind it should have more mp; the camera has only 10 mp. When holding the camera it doesn't feel plastically like some cameras do. like the leather safety strap.Any family looking for a new camera for their vacations should consider this camera. But if you are a more advance photographer you will be disappointed with some of the manual features. Also consider what is it that you are going to use the camera for. Eg: if i want to take pictures of animals in a distance i should probably buy the camera and a lens that gives me more focus control or a color filter. Or if I am going to use this camera for landscapes then i should probably get a wide opening lens.Don't buy the camera yet, go to a best buy or something and try it out, it should feel natural to hold. While you are there you should ask for more information.

Reviews.Title: Great Beginner D-SLR
Reviews.Author: Dude Of All Trades
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a couple of years. I bought it when a major box store was going out of business. It replaced my worn-out Digital Rebel. It did everything I have wanted but one thing. On very long exposures, usually over 6 seconds, I would get 'blooms' around certain pixels. Canon was willing to fix it, but since it was a low-usage annoyance and one that I could overcome with Photoshop, I elected not to surrender my camera that long. I will soon be replacing this with either the new T3i or the 60d.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: CR Stuart "Rick"
Reviews.Content: I bought this one for my Daughter.  She just finished a college photography class where she used my Rebel and said it was the best camera of all her classmates.  I also bought the exact same camera for my Son and Daughter-in-law last Christmas and they still rave about what a great camera it is.I always used mine on full auto and thought it did a fine job.  My daughter learned how to use all the fancy manual settings and meters that the camera has and she made some awesome pics using that mode.Great camera, great service from Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: awsome camera
Reviews.Author: victor tong
Reviews.Content: great product. i am a beginner at this so everything is kind of new for me. but it is very easy to use and picture quality is very nice. this camera can do a whole lot more once you get past the beginner stuff, but it will take a while to get everything down. but overall a very satisfy purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Way to Get Started
Reviews.Author: K. Chandler
Reviews.Content: I bought a Rebel XS in transition from film to digital photography. It is a great way for beginners and advanced users to enter the digital realm. It takes decent pictures with the included kit lens and is very easy to use. It has a ton of features and prepared me to step up to the semi-professional 7D a few months later.

Reviews.Title: What a Great Camera
Reviews.Author: MP "MP"
Reviews.Content: In my humble opinion, any beginner to intermediate photographer cannot go wrong with this camera. I may not have the experience like some but I will say this: As a father of 4, I have no problems getting great shots of my family at any activity. Be it indoors or out, low light or in the sun, my pictures are 90% fantastic. The other 10% is my own error (rushing the shot, moving, etc...).It is easy to setup, takes a little more time to understand all of the features but by no means impossible. Requires a little patience and understanding (like any new device).I purchased the telephoto lens, battery grip, lens covers and speedlight and I just love the quality, speed and ease that I have to enjoy these precious moments. And with the help of Photoshop, even little mistakes disappear. All of this for an investment of less than $1,000.In these times when dollars are a little harder to come by, I found this to be a great value and extremely satisfying.

Reviews.Title: This is my 3rd Rebel...
Reviews.Author: T. Leech "Tammy"
Reviews.Content: This is the third Canon rebel that I have owned in the past 10 years, I started in the pre-digital age with a film version.  I really love this camera, it works for everything I need it to do.  I am taking a photography class and this thing does all the 'tricks' needed to complete assignments, but it is also my go-to camera to use as a point and shoot with the premade settings.  I like that the screen on the back is larger than my older Rebel, much easier to take a peek at what I've got.  I have had no problems at all with programming or using this camera.  Until I have finished photography school and actually open my own business and get a large frame camera, like a 5D, I will be sticking with the Rebel.

Reviews.Title: Lots of bells and whistles.
Reviews.Author: Mike Killingsworth "Tru 2  blues"
Reviews.Content: The Canon XS is the best camera I have owned so far.  It has a lot of options, many of which I have not used to date, but I will be taking a class at the local community college that will show me what it can do that I have not yet done.  I just find it hard to sit down and read a manual that is close to 150 pages long.  I'd just as soon read the tax codes.

Reviews.Title: Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: Erico Panaro
Reviews.Content: Excelent for starter user's. I really recommend Canon Rebel XS for people  that love photography and don't wanna to have a simple digital camera... You just need to buy another lens, like Canon EF 55-250 mm, so you'll  have more mobility!

Reviews.Title: I actually does take better pictures
Reviews.Author: M. Spencer "Spencer"
Reviews.Content: In my family we've just used the point and shoot variety of digital cameras, but when my daughter began talking a strong interest in photography we upgraded. Now it's hard to be satisfied with my point and shoot when I see the pictures she gets from this camera. Looks like I am going to be upgrading too.

Reviews.Title: Super Quality low priced DSLR
Reviews.Author: L. Schrader
Reviews.Content: I use a simple remote timer with this camera and shoot time lapse sequences I assemble in 1080P.  This is one of the cleanest cameras I have shot with 1600ISO.  No grain noise when playing 24 frames a second back.  Amazing, continuous shooting at 1fps in HQ jpeg.  Only downside is live view does not have hdmi output to check for sensor dust.  I own several camera bodies, and things that slow down regular cleaning of bodies eat more time.  So you have to check for sensor dust the old way, by shooting a white image and loading sd card to computer.The camera is so light and cheap, I can have more lens attached to bodies, and not have to change lens in the field which lessons chances of sensor dust.  I would rather have 3 of these bodies for shooting stills with different lens on each one then one 7d body with just one lens.  Heck you can almost buy 4 of these for what one 7D cost.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: GypsyKat
Reviews.Content: Love the camera, love the pictures however the auto focus stopped working whitin the first month and I returned the camera. I trust Canon and will purchase another one local so I won't have to mail it in case something goes wrong.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Christopher T. Brown
Reviews.Content: My camera arrived yesterday & I love it! The supplier included everything that said would be included and he was very nice when there was a confusion over shipping price and he even refunded the extra money I had paid for shipping!  My only complaint was how long the shipping took, but that was because of a mix up at the shipping company, not at all the sellers fault. I would recommend buying from here!

Reviews.Title: canon rebel xs
Reviews.Author: John R. Sureemee
Reviews.Content: this is my first DSLR. it was between the NIKON D3000 or the CANON XS. both are good choices. the canon has live view, but not in auto mode, that was a bit of a suprise, but DSLR camera users typically use the viewfinder so it is not a problem. the LCD screen is smaller than i prefer, but still ok. i am fine with the CANON, but the NIKON would have been fine also.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: Graham J. Odonnell "GJINUSA"
Reviews.Content: I am quite impressed with this camera. I purchased it to replace my lost Fuji S5200. All the features are great and I expect many years of great pictures with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: J. sadaram "Jay S"
Reviews.Content: If  you are debating to XS or Xsi, go for an XSi and pick a bigger lens too.. the 18-55mm works great, which is sufficient for domestic purposes.. but we buy a DSLR for outdoor shooting is it? so look for 300mm max one is great and not that costly either... finally it depends on what you are using it for.. but as many blogs said this is a next level cam after point and shootsCorns: There is not video mode to record a video...

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: Bill A. Belt
Reviews.Content: This has been a great little camera. It is not for the professional as the professional may want more out of a camera. Lightweight, easy to use and great photos in almost any kind of light. This is a great first camera for someone just getting into digital.

Reviews.Title: Its a great camera!
Reviews.Author: H. Maddula
Reviews.Content: This is my 1st DSLR cameras.I used to point an shoot cameras only.Even though it is easy to use and simpler than you think.Live view feature is helping me a lot.

Reviews.Title: Good as far as now
Reviews.Author: An Pan "Mike Pan"
Reviews.Content: This is my first slr, it is good, the quality is high, easy to use; I recommend for first users!

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS 10.1MP Digital is excellent at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: John M. Mizerka
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased as a gift for my wife.  She has enjoyed it very much and was able to quickly learn how to take very good pictures.  It came with an EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Lens which seems to be a very versatile lens for overall family picture taking and ease of use. Grandchildren and great grandchildren have already been photographed for our enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS - it's a good thing
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Lopiccola
Reviews.Content: I had been waiting for waiting for this camera to reach a price I could afford, and it finally did.  It was worth the wait.It operates similar to the 35mm film version, and is extremely fast compared to the "point-and-shoots" I have been using for the last 10 years or so.  This is not the latest and greatest that Canon currently makes, but it does what I need it to do.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Matney
Reviews.Content: The XS is a great camera. I bought it for $409 through Amazon and even though the XSi has a few more options the price difference made me choose the XS. I used the savings to purchase an additional lens. The camera is easy to use and takes some great photos.

Reviews.Title: Great for a Beginner
Reviews.Author: William Kellogg
Reviews.Content: I'm a rank beginner in the world of photography and am definitely happy with my purchase of this camera! I picked it based on the (relative) simplicity of the features, cost, and size/shape.If you are debating between a Nikon and Canon, like I was, I would suggest going to a Best Buy or a camera shop and holding the cameras themselves. Nikons always seem to be a bit cheaper, but I found that they didn't fit in my hands as well and that their menu systems were less intuitive (for me, anyways). This is a great camera, though, and I would definitely recommend checking it out if you're looking to get a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Metzger
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR. I really like it because it's easy to use if you're a beginner and it has some nice features if you want to get into serious photography. The colors in my photos are great and my photos are very crisp and clear. I think the kit lens is fantastic, though I do plan on purchasing a telephoto lens in the near future. I'm still learning about this camera, but so far it is everything I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Good one for the Price
Reviews.Author: S. Nekkanti "Nekkanti"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Cameara as my firsdt SLR camera and found  it very impressive. I just started playing around with the camera at home with my kid and found the picture quality really outstanding. I also bought extra lens of 75-300mm telephoto lens and need to explore more with this camera. Finally i feel good buy for the price. Must have for the family with kids.just go for it..

Reviews.Title: Opened Package
Reviews.Author: Harry P Wilson III
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Amazon directly. My camera appears to have been returned as it was repackaged, which is something I do not care for. I will keep what appears a decent machine, but am wondering what may (?) be wrong with it?It is likely I will not use Amazon for such a purpose in the future. Let the buyer beware, methinks.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Evan Lovely
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. The only way to get it better is to pay more: it'd be nice to have the DIGIC 4, but that's not what this package is offering.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: WMR
Reviews.Content: The Canon Rebel XS is a nice starter digital SLR camera. Takes great pictures and has many useful features, which I am still learning how to use. The camera is not too heavy and it seems to be sturdy in its construction. This particular brand/model seemed to come highly recommended from various sources, and so far, I am very pleased with it! The price (at least on Amazon.com) was really good too!

Reviews.Title: Great dLSR for a good price
Reviews.Author: TAZ
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning about all of the camera's possibilities.  Got some great stop-motion pictures of small birds and dogs.  Picture quality is excellent.  I did a lot of research before I bought this camera.  I don't find the focus dots to be a problem.  I like the controls on the right side, they're easy to operate and the camera fits my hand just fine.  There were a few reviews talking about the camera getting damp and never operating again.  To prevent condensation, I follow the Canon recommendation of removing the lens from the body when coming in from the cold to a warm room.  I've even done it (carefully) after getting back into a warm car.  The camera and lens don't take long to warm up.  This is one of the lightest dSLRs on the market, a real plus when adding a telephoto lens.

Reviews.Title: Bought for the speed
Reviews.Author: RMG "ASU OC DEVIL"
Reviews.Content: Those of you upgrading from a Point and Shoot camera can relate to the lag time between photos. We got so tired of waiting for our PNS to spool up to take another photo we finally upgraded to this DSLR. Wish I had done it 3 years ago. This Rebel is so easy to use and the pictures are great and best of all it is super fast. I am a total Neophyte when it comes to cameras; I just want a good picture. This product delivers and I think the cost is spot on.

Reviews.Title: 4th Bought for This Family
Reviews.Author: A. P. Jr. "family photo choice"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera that takes pictures of high quality.  It meets the needs of this grandma who prefers a simple camera to use yet has all the features that the expert photographer in the family might want.  Our family has purchased 4 of these cameras and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: The best camera for this amazing price
Reviews.Author: D. Civil "Honesty"
Reviews.Content: The Rebel XS is a very well built camera, easy to use, with all the features that I need in a camera. The EF-S 18-55mm lens is a wide angle lens and works very well. This camera takes 3 frames per second great for any kind of event. The Canon Rebel XSi which is a more expensive camera has more megapixels and a wider screen that's all. For the money saved the Rebel XS is a winner. I have researched all the DSLR cameras on the market and this one is truly the best for the price. The minute I opened the box I knew I had a winner.

Reviews.Title: cannons perfect camera
Reviews.Author: Wayne B. Sutter
Reviews.Content: this camera will do just about everything you need to take perfect pictures every time.simple to use and set up.extra lenze 55-250 makes this realy a great camera to own,would tell friend to buy.amazon has great priceing one this camera and not to many stores offer it at a great price of $460.00+exta for zoom lenze

Reviews.Title: Initial Experience
Reviews.Author: D. Manthos "D.L. Manthos"
Reviews.Content: This was my Christmas present to me, and so far I have been absolutely thrilled with this camera. I will need more experience to figure out all of the settings, manual operation, and (blast, actually have to read the instruction manual :P). However, the intuitive features, fast responding lens and overall feel of this camera are even more than I expected. I am sure I will get many wonderful experiences with this camera in the future, so thanks to Canon for making such a great entry level dSLR!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Entry Level DSLR
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: This product was bought for a digital photography class. I grabbed this one because it was easy to use. Many features are nice. The full auto function works well.. But not when you are expecting something more... Also The lens that comes with this is OK. It gets the job done. However, It doesn't really allow you to zoom in very far. For example, I took a photo of a spider, however, I had to get about a foot away from it before it would zoom to the crop that I was looking for. The quality of the pictures is awesome! Even if you can't zoom in as far as you want, you could always zoom in on the computer and crop. The deep colors in this SLR are amazing. On the Landscape setting you get deeper and richer colors in your blues and greens. Kind of a post card effect. Overall, I am very satisfied with this SLR.

Reviews.Title: Great starter camera!
Reviews.Author: S. M. Plimmer "Mrs. A"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a few months ago.  I love it.  If you are looking for a nice camera to take pictures of your family, friends, pets, home, etc.  This camera is perfect!  I love the pictures & although I'm still learning all the tricks, its easy to use and understand.  I have recently bought a higher quality lens and some other accessories that I think will take my photography to the next level, but don't feel like you need to buy accessories because it works great as is.  I HIGHLY recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Happy with the camera
Reviews.Author: Pam D
Reviews.Content: This camera was a 1st Father's Day gift for my husband.  It is our first Digital SLR and has been serving its purpose well so far.  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great product and reliable seller
Reviews.Author: K. Bilgin "tompan zochelty"
Reviews.Content: The product is just as described and arrived very quick in great condition. Thanks to the highly reliable seller, Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Silver Canon Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: Victoria Phelan "voracious reader"
Reviews.Content: Affordable and loaded with features, this is a terrific introductory camera for digital aficionados. Selecting the silver made my high school graduates' gift a little more personal; everyone has a black camera, after all! The camera uses a standard memory card that is available literally everywhere, and it's functions are deluxe but easy to learn to operate.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Wait
Reviews.Author: Y. Dimirco "auntie"
Reviews.Content: I waited a long time before buying this camera, looked up all the pros and cons. I am so glad I bought it, it is worth the wait. I love the picture quality and ease of use. I bought a book and a lens also to get the most out of the camera but I was able to use it right from the box since I have always had a Canon. The quality of the photos is amazing and I have taken some great shots already. If you are thinking of buying it I say "go for it".

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Buy
Reviews.Author: Seth Eaton
Reviews.Content: High quality, simple to use, yet loaded with various features to explore. An ideal purchase for those looking to break away from the point-and-shoot crowd.

Reviews.Title: Great starter to SLR
Reviews.Author: Fourier Transform
Reviews.Content: We bought this 4 months ago from Amazon for $500. It came with the kit lens 18-55mm (I think). This was our first step to SLR. Sure enough, it produced wonderful pictures of landscape, close-ups and portraits.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Shannon M. Potter "Science Nerd"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have a 35mm Canon Rebel, so I knew I'd like the digital version. Great camera for those wanting to take professional photos on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS 10.1 MP
Reviews.Author: sony
Reviews.Content: This camera is ideal for the first time user.  It is user friendly.  Although I would say that I did take a mini course and maybe that helped a bit, too.  The camera is in top condition and I bought it less than retail value.  What a bargain!

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Chris "Christian"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a couple weeks ago and all the pictures I've taken have left me (and everyone I know) highly impressed.  No complaints.  Great camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS is a Great Camera
Reviews.Author: lindy "lindy"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I already had one.  My kids gave it to me for Christmas.  My father wanted a Camera and he asked a professional photographer what he would recommend.  He told him the Canon Rebel.  I could have told him that.  So, I ordered one for my dad thru Amazon.com.  The camera was a little slow in shipping but otherwise just great!!!!  We love this camera.  It is so easy to use for the beginner but advanced enough for the professional.  You can not go wrong!!!

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal!
Reviews.Author: L. A. Lenoir "movielover"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I feel like a professional photographer. It is really great and it takes the "true color" of the things you photgraph with it. I would recommend it to any one..

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel Digital SLR
Reviews.Author: E. M. Skidmore
Reviews.Content: I love my new SLR.  The lens that comes with it is a good utility lens but I immediately bought a telephoto zoom and the combination is excellent.  This is my fourth Canon digital camera and I really would pay more to get a Canon.  But I have to admit it took me several years to bite the bullet and get the SLR. I got wonderful pictures from my point and shoot but its really nice to have the added flexibility and features. The battery has real staying power, I can take shots just about as fast as I can compose them, with a 4 gig card it holds a ton of pictures...  I'm in hog heaven.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera Value
Reviews.Author: M. Loftis
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera with all the functionality of the nicest 35mm film camera, but extremely easy to use even if you don't have time to learn all the extras.  Resolution is excellent for the price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: LMR
Reviews.Content: It is so easy to use.  I am still learning all of its functions but produces wonderful pictures. This camera was recommended to me by several friends who also have a rebel.  It is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: T Cunningham "T Cunningham"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, I am a huge Canon fan though, so I am very biased.  I do photography as a hobby and for friends who need portraits or events done and this camera is perfect for those small events where a heavy camera would be too much.For better options do add a remote and a few other lenses so that you can expand your ability and function.

Reviews.Title: Everyone's Green with Envy...it helps my ego
Reviews.Author: Monique S. Wright "Mon!que"
Reviews.Content: As indicated in the the title, this is a great first time SLR digital camera. I wanted a new camera. And being quite the novice when it comes to the mechanics of cameras, this one was recommended, and I have fallen in love with it. Its so much more than the traditional point and shoot camera, but its nice to be able to use it as that also. I <3 the quality and versatility of the pictures this little baby takes...and plus is its super light. The price was great too, especially being a full time student  desperately seeking economical hobbies.

Reviews.Title: Gives Great Lighting and Clear Pictures!
Reviews.Author: Victoria Pezzella
Reviews.Content: After reviewing and reviewing various beginner DSLRs, I decided to purchase this Cannon XS Rebel. The camera is very easy to use and I find it gives great quality pictures. It adds light where it is most needed and this gives each picture a clear, focused feel. The shutter is very fast. Although I like being able to just look through the viewfinder when taking pictures, sometimes the lack of Live View on the LCD gets in the way of being able to take a picture above your head when you have an obstruction in front of you. This is only a minor setback. I couldn't decide between this and the Nikon D60, so ultimately the price on this camera made my decision. I am happy with this camera and in a couple of years, I will probably upgrade to a new cannon model.

Reviews.Title: Great replacement for the EOS Rebel Ti film camera
Reviews.Author: S. L. Engel
Reviews.Content: After much review and after considering my favorable experinece with the Canon PowerShot A590IS, i decided to buy this camera about 2 months ago.  I am totally amazed by it!  First off, all my optics and flash that I used with the film camera work with this camera flawlessly.  The resolution of the pictures and the colors are excellent.  The autofocus is FAST.  What I like the most about it is that is it light weight (like my film camera was) and with the the 2GB memory card I can take 1,600 pictures and not having to change films after every 24th frame.  It is great to be able to see the picture right after I took it.  I beleive I have a good combination on hand: take the wide angle general purpose photos with my PowerShot A590IS and use this camera with my 300 mm optically stabilized telephoto.  Only one negative comment:  the autofocus function in the real image view settings is LAME.  So much so, that I do not even use it.  I can not understand how that same function in the much less expensive PowerShot works so well, yet in this camera it is nearly useless.  My overall rating = 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Prat
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera only recently, and absolutely love it. Easy to use and is quite flexible. Canon SLRs rock.

Reviews.Title: My Daughter's New Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Bundrick
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the camera.  It is my daughter's first SLR camera (she's an adult) and she'd been very hesitant to get one, but she's delighted with it, and so am I.  The directions are easy for a beginning photographer to understand, and I'm quite confident she will get some very nice pictures with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Great Price
Reviews.Author: Tina V
Reviews.Content: I'm new to photography and received this as a X-mas gift from my husband.  For the past four month with hands on, it's a great camera.  I gotta admit tho, the stock lens isn't the greatest, but it does the job.  I did get a tamron 18-270mm zoom lens and a canon 50mm f/1.8 about 2 weeks ago that does a great job and less editing.  But I am very pleased with overall the quality.  I would recommend this camera for any starters and you cannot beat the price!

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera
Reviews.Author: SJ
Reviews.Content: This Canon Rebel is exceptionally well-designed. It works right out of the box with reliable automatic settings and can function with point-and-shoot simplicity. On the other hand, photographers that choose to take advantage of manual settings have a ton of control. Best of all, picture quality and ease of use are second to none. I love mine!

Reviews.Title: Pleased so far
Reviews.Author: Tracie M. Carr
Reviews.Content: I finally made the leap to a DSLR and I think I chose the right camera. I did have a Konica Minolta Z5 and had been extremely pleased with it. The Canon is nice and hasn't been too difficult to learn. I wish it came with a better lens but for the price I'm happy with the results.

Reviews.Title: Great entry dSLR
Reviews.Author: MsFrisby "Barefoot Librarian"
Reviews.Content: This is the first camera I've used that is a dSLR and I'm really enjoying it. If you've never used this kind of camera before, then I'd recommend getting a book on dSLR cameras to really begin to understand how it works. However, I love this camera. The images are crisp and it's a definite step forward as far photography goes.

Reviews.Title: very good first impression
Reviews.Author: R. Strasbourg "R.S."
Reviews.Content: I received this camera about two weeks ago and tested it outside, taking amazing shots of birds in flight,also architecture and inside for studio portraits and a concert in very low light.It didn't take long for me to browse through the manual and find everything I wanted to know about the camera.The result is very clear photographs and a camera that's easy to use, quickly. I purchased a tamron 70-300 zoom also and it works great with the camera.Definitely a great upgrade from my point-and-shoot, a fujifilm finepix s9000. Good camera but a bit more complicated to use and limited for long distance and low light shots.This is my first Canon and I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Beginning Photographer
Reviews.Author: Jo Bolton
Reviews.Content: I am a beginner in the world of photography beyond the point and shoot camera. I chose this camera for the great features it has, the price, and the size. I have small hands and it is perfect for me. I would recommend this camera to anyone beginner or more advanced.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Paula J. Rowell
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon Rebel XS a few weeks ago and I love it. I have a problem with "shaky hands" and the Image Stabilization helps me immensly. I also purchased the 250mm IS lens along with the 50mm 1:1.8 lens. The 50mm does not have IS but I love this lens. I recently did some photos of children and this lens really did the job, they were great! I highly recommend this Canon as well as the lenses.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: Lauro Bolado Navarro
Reviews.Content: The purchase was great.The only thing i was a little disconcerted was that i selected one-day package and the camera arrived after two days, but other than that, the experience was very good.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Marcelo C. "MarceloC"
Reviews.Content: I love his camera.I did not know what I was missing using point-and-shoot cameras.I bought it for a College class, but I love it.Very good quality equipment and an impressive range of features and options. Very good semi-pro camera for the beginner and with a price that can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Sturgess
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a few reasons: one is that I've used Canon cameras before and found them to be of a very good quality and very-user friendly, and after reading some of the reviews of the Rebel XS, it seemed that this camera would be no exception. Also, the price was very reasonable, considering what DSLR's usually sell for.This is my first DSLR camera, and I've found that it was very easy to get used to all the settings and takes some very good-quality shots. This is a perfect camera for anyone new to DSLR, or even an advanced amateur or hobbyist. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: turbobeagle
Reviews.Content: It looks like the price of the camera has gone up by about $50 since I bought this a couple months ago.  At the price I paid, I felt it was a great value and is a great entry point into the DSLR world for those of us who aren't really sure that we're going to stick with it as a serious hobby.  Truth be told, I did go to a physical store to hold a few cameras and I do agree with others that the Nikons "feel" better but it was a very minor difference and not worth the price difference in my opinon.  This camera is a great value for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Canon Digital Rebel XS 10 Megapixel DSLR Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul Deutsch "Captain Marvel"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for someone who is moving from a point and shoot type camera to the more capable DSLR type. Focus is so much faster. Detail is much better than even my best P&S; camera. I wish I would have done it years ago.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: Michael M. Smith
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It's light but durable. The controls are easy to use and sensible. The kit lens is much better than kit lenses on the previous digital Rebels. And the image stabilizer really works. It would be nice to have higher ISO than 1600. But images taken at ISO 1600 have less "noise" than with my original digital Rebel or my XTi. Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: R. Gordon
Reviews.Content: This is my first Digital SLR and I am still learning but it has been great thusfar... takes fabulous photos!

Reviews.Title: Great camera straight out of the box
Reviews.Author: SirBee "Sha"
Reviews.Content: This is my first SLR camera. I was able to assemble it, figure out the settings and take beautiful shots right out of the box. I would definitely recommend that you try one out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: Very good Cam..
Reviews.Author: Andrea Pico "Pretty Mom"
Reviews.Content: You want Perfect pics well get this cam..this is the real deala nd cheaper than other cameras..the only thing i ddnt like aboutt hsi cam is that when you have it on the screen you cant zoom in..sucks..but overall i love it..

Reviews.Title: Cool
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I like this camera a lot, takes great quality pictures. Still trying to figure out how to use it properly. I have to keep going to "clear camera settings" to put it back to the default settings cos i mess it up so much. lol. It'll take a little while to learn how to use all the manual stuff, but it's fun so i don't mind :)Point and shoot just seems so boring now!

Reviews.Title: JM
Reviews.Author: M. Mao "It is not the critic who counts"
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT CAMERA, LENS IS VERY BASIC ALTHOUGH OF GOOD QUALITY, MIGHT NEED TO CONSIDER UPGRADING THE LENS.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Dagne Setterfield "Dagne"
Reviews.Content: I previously had a Canon Rebel X and a couple of lenses and loved it but had stopped using it because I got tired of using film.  My husband surprised me with the Canon Rebel XS this Christmas so that I could use my great lenses again.  I love this one just as much or more.  Still have not had time to learn to use all of its MANY features but am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: WJ in TX
Reviews.Content: I bought my wife the Canon Rebel XS 10.1MP Digital SLR Camera with EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Lens AND Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Telephoto Zoom Lens package for $460 shipped.  She had been interested in photography for 2+ years and had been using our Canon Powershot SD700 IS for her photography projects.When we bought the SD700 IS 2 years ago, it was almost $500.  Needless to say, the Rebel XS package is an amazing bargain at $460 and the difference in image quality is unbelievable.I should have bought 2.

Reviews.Title: Good DSLR for first timers..
Reviews.Author: Sri Dhanush "Sri"
Reviews.Content: I have had this model for over a month now and i am really impressed with the images it can produce. If you are on a tight budget and on the lookout for an entry level DSLR, then you have 2 choices... the Nikon D40 and the rebel XS. Although the latter costs a bit more than the Nikon, the extra buck is well spent since you get a bigger sensor and upto date features commonly found in more costly DSLRs from Canon. The results are very good with the automatic settings. Probably the best thing that canon has done is to include an IS enabled 18-55mm lens which works very well. However, if you are serious about DSLR photography, you will find that upgrading to a good lens will make a big difference.. as for casual users, its the best you can get for the money you pay. Worth it!

Reviews.Title: Old Lenses do fit! very pleased!
Reviews.Author: R. Paul Hilburn
Reviews.Content: I have had a canon rebel 35mm camera for 10 years now, I already have a nice camera bag, tripod and several lenses and filters. I really wanted to switch to a digital but wanted to buy body only. I had several sales people tell me that the pics just wouldnt turn out right. I found a friend who just bought and xti and we did some experimenting, no diff whatsoever. I found a refurbished body only on amazon, perfect price, came just when I wanted it to, looks in perfect condition. I have only had it a couple of days, and I love it. My daughter closes her eyes for shots all the time, now I can review and shoot again. Has all the same features of my old, SLR just now its digital, takes B&W;, you can adjust your ISO 'film speed', etc. I think for a hobbyist trying to update their 35mm setup, this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Little Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Karen L. Olson "Seamistress of Longships"
Reviews.Content: I researched for some time to upgrade from a Canon A570 point and shoot...a nice camera but not up to my skill level at photography. So I came upon the Rebels and the new XS. I am very pleased with the outcomes so far. This is very easy to use, being familiar with Canon products and the autolevels are accurate.Fantastic camera, everyone who has looked at my photos want to know what camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Pics
Reviews.Author: Katrina D. Flynn "Camera Girl"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Now, I am no expert but I am a picture fanatic and these pics are beautiful. It is my first SLR. I've wanted one for a while. And it was well worth it. The only thing I wish it had was a wireless remote. It has a remote that you connect to the camera with a wire, (bought seperatly), and it works great. I take alot of family photos, sometimes with me in them, and the wireless would be easier. Other than that, great product, great price, great pics.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: M. Coggins
Reviews.Content: I didn't have nor wanted to waste the extra money on the xsi.  Spend your money on nice lenses.  That is what will make the big difference in your photos not the body so much.  Not much else to say, it's a Canon.  Can't go wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: Error 99
Reviews.Author: carterk
Reviews.Content: We used this camera very lightly, taking under 1000 pictures with it in the 16 months that it worked. Then it started reporting 'Error #99", an unhelpful code that could mean any one of a number of things. Apparently repair starts at about $250.I'm furious. We babied this thing, kept it in a padded case, using our pocket camera for most shots and only pulling this thing out for special occasions. For something that costs as much as this does, it's ludicrous that Canon expects the thousands of customers experiencing this common problem to spend over half the thing's original cost to repair it.We've had great luck with Canon's pocket cameras but I'll never give this company another dime of our money.

Reviews.Title: Blown Away...
Reviews.Author: Robert Rubenking "Rabbi Bob"
Reviews.Content: After damaging my second Canon AE-1P in the middle 1990's, I switched to an entry level digital camera that did not always satisfy my needs.  However, my new Canon Rebel EOS XS not only satisfies my needs for a competent camera, but it blows away anything I have ever even tried in a comparable price range.  My expectations were more than satisfied.With my old Canon AE-1P's, I had to take 14-20 rolls of 35mm film with me whenever I went overseas, along with an extra battery --- just in case.  And the cost of developing and printing all those photos was a real budget beater. And with our 5.2 mp entry level digital camera, while it was easy to recharge it in its own camera dock, nevertheless, the recharging dock was somewhat bulky, and we had to take a number of memory sticks with us or be careful that we had enough exposures left to get all the photos we wanted. However, my new Canon Rebel EOS XS came with its own battery recharger (a fraction of the size of a single deck of playing cards), and the 4 GB memory (purchased locally)is way beyond comparison with everything I had tried previously.We took the new camera on vacation, a few weeks ago, and were blown away by its performance.  It made no difference whether we had day light, low light, or no light.  The functions and variable ISO settings were more than enough to handle anything from bright light to low light, and the pop up flash took care of everything in the dark...

Reviews.Title: Fine, but overpriced, camera
Reviews.Author: Hiram Grant "just call me Sam"
Reviews.Content: We are now seeing a real first...the first Digital EOS that hasn't got people flocking to the stores.  Why?  Price, and a lack of anything "innovative".  However, on the good front, speaking with a Canon Sales Rep, he has told me to expect the gap between the XSi and XS to quickly go to $200, which is a more realistic valuation, and would probably warranty another star, as the XS is really a very nice camera.You've probably seen many lists comparing the XS to the XSi, and noticed the shortcomings, which are too numerous for $100.  However, compared to some of the competition, it's not all bad.  Take as an example the Nikon D60.  Both are 10mp, but the Canon is a CMOS sensor, that should produce a tad better photos in poor lighting conditions.  You also get a 7-point AF system vs. 3-point.Compared to the Sony Alpha 300, it's hard pay $100 premium, considering the Alpha has in camera stabalization, supports wireless flashes (with built-in flash) and has a 2.7" tiltable live-view.  But the Canon kit lens is better optically, and the build quality appears to be slightly better on the XS.  When the price drops, they'll be equally good values.But as most people have said, the XSi is a 5-star camera worth $200 extra; therefore, the price of the XS needs to reflect that reality.

Reviews.Title: Went belly up the day after I got it.
Reviews.Author: Kaaib
Reviews.Content: I had a lot of fun with it the day I got it, but the next day when I turnedit on the display showed "Err99 turn camera off and then back on or replacebattery". I turned it off and on and still got the error. took the battery outand put it back in and got the same thing. I wish that I would have read moreof the reviews before I bought it. I would have known that it was a commonproblem with Cannon cameras.  Actually I am happy it broke on me, I sent it back and ordered a Pentax k-rand am very happy with it. The Pentax cost a little more but it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Beginner DSLR
Reviews.Author: Wyatt
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for almost two years. This is a great started DSLR now that they discontinued i would recommend the Canon t3i or if you have the extra money go for the t4i. The only feature i missed  is the video feature. Great product for first DSLR and for learning all of the features a DSLR can offer you.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for an entry-level DSLR
Reviews.Author: jtp
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera and kit lens about a year and a half ago.  This camera is all you need if you are just starting out with DSLR's.  I was told by several people to get an entry level camera to learn all that I can learn and then upgrade, and I'm so happy I did.  This little guy taught me the basics and was very user friendly.  After diving in head first, I'm just at the point where I'm ready for something with more capabilities and just ordered the 60D yesterday.  I have already had 3 people interested in purchasing this guy from me so I'm pretty sure, as long as you take great care of it, you won't have a hard time selling it when you are ready to upgrade.  I'm only selling the body because the kit lens is a really great all-purpose lens to have around, in addition to some sort of prime lens.  It's not going to produce pictures a $3000 camera will but it sure does take you into a new realm if all you have ever shot is a point and shoot.  The pictures are crisp and it does pretty well in low light considering the price.

Reviews.Title: Solid
Reviews.Author: Brian T. Lang "BLan"
Reviews.Content: Very good quality camera. We bought it to take pics of our daughter (10months) and this camera has not disappointed. The lens it comes with is good for close photos but definitely get a larger zoom lens if you are taking pics more than 20 feet away.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: lisa
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  Being able to have the sports option is great.  Instead of getting a picture that is past the event, you can just hold the button and it clicks away and you will get the shot you want without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: at this price, a real bargain
Reviews.Author: achuiche
Reviews.Content: nice camera for beginners (my 21 years old daugther)at this price, it's a very goog bargain.this refurbished item is as new

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: Mia's Mom
Reviews.Content: I am completely new to the SLR world, and this camera has been a lot of fun to use.  I have been able to catch that "perfect shot" without the delay of my old point and shoot.  Uploading to my computer could not be easier.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: fossil fan
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camara and happy with the price and its working. Can suggest my friends t obuy it.

Reviews.Title: Simply Great !!
Reviews.Author: Vlovern "VN"
Reviews.Content: Its an year now since I own this amazing camera.Thanks to Amazon I decided to buy this one after reading reviews here.Its very easy to handle, even amateurs can click amzing pictures.Buy it you wont regret :)[...]

Reviews.Title: This is the digital SLR camera to buy!
Reviews.Author: B. Thompson
Reviews.Content: The camera is everything the information given said it was. I couldn't be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Palmer
Reviews.Content: I am really happy with the camera overall.  The lens that came with it was rubbish, broke on us twice in under six months and Canon would only fix it once so that sucked.  Besides that, it does everything we want it too.

Reviews.Title: Great for a first time DSLR
Reviews.Author: Erik Arce
Reviews.Content: After having it for a couple of days, I can say that the image quality on just the auto shots are amazing. I bought the book for "dummies" for the xs to help with the advanced exposure options. But for now the auto is damn good. Then again I'm coming from a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, Good quality.
Reviews.Author: E. Albino
Reviews.Content: Hi, i just owned this camera, and it is good for me, it is my first DSLR camera ever, and i loved, i will never lost again the fast moment of my kids, with the 3fps that it can take.It is so well done, you can adjust a tons of options.the lens that comes with it 18-55mm it is good for short distance, and have IS(image stabilization). but not a big chance to adjust manually the focus.i did buy also for this camera the Tamron AF 75-300mm f/4.0-5.6 LD for Canon Digital SLR CamerasSold by: Beach Camera, and it is so good for this camera, you can take good pictures with it.Pros.: good quality, fast response,etc.cons.: weight.if you are looking for a good camera this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: A. Wells
Reviews.Content: This camera is my baby. I take it everywhere. I love it soooo much. :]

Reviews.Title: Great SLR camera for beginners
Reviews.Author: Pete Chen
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the bells and whistles for a DSLR beginner. I am extremely happy with it. If you are looking for the best value for entry level DSLR, then this is not the best value. Nikon and Olympus have better deals. But I want to have the huge selections of lens. Besides, I am pretty comfortable with the controls of my two Canon point-and-shoot cameras. The only complaint I have is the layout of the auto focus points. It has seven. Five of them are on the middle horizontal line. The sixth one is right above the center, and the seventh one below the center. If you want to focus roughly around the centers of four quadrants, then you have to move your camera to compose your picture after you focus using one of the focus points. This is quite inconvenient and causes incorrect focusing if the subject is close to you. XSi has nine auto focus points nicely laid out. But it costs you about two hundred dollars more.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Danilo Cruz
Reviews.Content: I'm a beginner in photography, but this camera seems to be what I need.Excellent Quality!

Reviews.Title: Only a month, but strong so far.
Reviews.Author: T. Frey
Reviews.Content: The 1000D is great so far, I've been out on some extended shooting days so far, and the battery life is great. I usually shoot around 400 photos on a single outing, and that doesn't put a significant dent in the battery life.The live view is cool, but I have used it, but I don't think you'll find yourself using it very much. It's also a significant drain on your battery. The continuous shooting is 3.5 shots per second on this camera, which is plenty fast for me, but if you're looking to do a series motion shots, this isn't going to shoot quite fast enough.The 18-55mm lens is a nice lens and is good for portraits and general shooting, but if you do any work beyond basic photography, you're going to want a longer lens. The 55mm lens can focus an a minimum distance of .25 meters (about 10 inches), which for me isn't really close enough to do macro shots. If you wanna zoom way in on something small, you're going to need a macro lens.All and all, probably the best camera I've seen for the money. Great stuff, the software it comes with is pretty useful as well, but not a replacement for photoshop.I love my XS, I'm going to be using it for quite some time. :)

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: N. currie
Reviews.Content: Very Happy with the purchase.  Bought soley for taking action shots of my son and daughter's lacrosse games and I've gotten some amazing shots.  I added a 300 mm lens for this as the one that comes standard would not get across the field.  Camera is a little heavy but I use the strap and that helps.  It focuses very well and you can take a bunch of shots on a battery charge.  I've taken upwards of 800 with and without flash and it was still going strong.  I use a 4gb card and you can put around 1600 pictures on it.  Wish you could shoot movies but I knew it wouldn't when purchasing it.  The only thing I didn't realize is that you don't get a display of what you're shooting.  You actually have to look through the viewfinder just as you did in the old days with cameras.  I'm getting used to that but still miss being able to just hold it out in front and snap.  Overall it's a very nice camera.  I've taken over 4000 pictures in 3 weeks and am still snapping away.  My 11 year old daughter loves it to. She's constantly taking action shots of our dogs and getting closeups of flowers around the yard.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Melissa Henderson
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I am having a blast playing with it and learning all the different settings. Takes a great picture.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel XS
Reviews.Author: sus
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! I am used to a film SLR, and a small point and shoot digital, but with how slow the point and shoot is, and not being able to see my shots right away with film, I just had to upgrade to a digital SLR! I did a good bit of research and was deciding between the XS and XSi. I have always been a Canon person, so that part was easy. We were looking for an econoical choice, and though there are some features on the XSi that are a bit better - the main differences appear to be the XS has a slightly smaller screen and slightly slower fps and only a bit less on the megapixels. To me, it was negligible and the cost was a few hundred dollars less. We have been getting beautiful pictures and have been having lots of fun with it. And with the fast shutter speed and quick ability to review shots, we haven't missed out on getting the shots like we used to on our point and shoot. I highly recommend this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Baron
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital SLR and I can tell the difference between the small digital cameras and the SLRs. It's really easy to use and lightweight to carry wherever you go, but the most amazing part are the amazing pictures you can achieve with this camera. If you are looking for a new camera ot to upgrade from plain digital to digital SLR, this is what you are looking for!

Reviews.Title: wonderful
Reviews.Author: Y. Thongtanunam
Reviews.Content: It's so wonderful for the beginner. It's not too complicate like some professional cameras, but the pictures will make you happy.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever had!!
Reviews.Author: Derek J. Olson
Reviews.Content: I am extremely happy with this camera!! Very easy to use!! Takes great photos!! It's definateley woth the money!!

Reviews.Title: Warranty issue
Reviews.Author: I. Anderson
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Canon Rebel XS after doing a lot of research online. I was looking for a nice introductory DSLR camera that was feature-rich but wouldn't break the bank. The XS seemed to fit the bill perfectly. I ordered the camera and out of the box it took great photos. I got a Tamron 300 zoom lens with the kit and I was able to take some spectacular skiing action shots on the first day I got it.After less than two months of use, the camera started freezing up and I would get an 'Error 99' message on the digital screen. The only way to get it working was to reset the camera by removing the battery. I did some digging online and discovered this is a general error message and a surprising number of XS owners were experiencing the same thing. The only solution was to send it in for warranty.Of course, I'm leaving for a European vacation next week so I paid to overnight the camera back to Canon. Their customer service assured me I would get the camera back within a week.Turns out, they couldn't/wouldn't get the repair completed in time, so now I'm without a camera for the trip.I am extremely disappointed in this product and Canon. The Error 99 warranty issue seems all too common if you search some of the forums and then Canon couldn't get the camera fixed in a timely fashion. I looked hard at the Nikon equivalent for this camera...wish I had chosen it instead.

Reviews.Title: Good pprchase!
Reviews.Author: R. L. Kerr "Stargeezer"
Reviews.Content: I am most happy with the camera . . can hardly wait to get the 70-200mm IS telephoto lense (when I can afford it). The versatility, fairly easy to follow instructions, and quality of image are all welcomed.

Reviews.Title: Former Photographer Back in Action
Reviews.Author: Rachel Young "rlflyer226"
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I have no complaints about this camera whatsoever. I used to be a photographer at a well known portrait studio and did my own photography as well (just for fun). Previously, I owned a DSLR Canon Rebel XT 8MP. I ended up selling it after having kids because I didn't think I'd ever use it again. But then a family member AND a friend started planning their weddings and they both choose me as their photographer. I immediately knew I had to get a DSLR again. I did lots of research and initially wanted a Nikon. I ended up choosing this Canon (mostly because of the price) but also because I so loved my previous Canon. It is very user friendly and is great for amature photographers, like myself, who want to expand their photo skills. The pictures for both weddings came out fantastic! At that point, I knew I had spent my money wisely. If you're looking to give your pocket-camera-photos a major upgrade, this camera is a budget-friendly way to do that. I recommend this camera to anyone wanting their first DSLR. It's super easy to learn. The body of the camera seems lighter than the lens itself which could make it feel cheap. But once you get going and start experimenting with all the settings, your pictures look anything but cheap. I've never owned a Nikon but would like to get one eventually. I've only heard good things about it but they can be so damn expensive. This Canon is a great way to produce professional looking photos without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera for landscape photography
Reviews.Author: RocketMan
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon XS DSLR camera with the intent of replacing a 5-year old Canon A630 point-and-shoot camera.  I had tried (and returned) several newer point-and-shoot cameras, but was disappointed with back-to-back comparisons to the older camera.  They did not compare well at all, and I assumed that a newer entry level DSLR should run circles around a 5-year old model.  That was not the case.In its favor, the Canon XS did extremely well in low-light conditions and for close-up photograpy.  However, for wide angle landscape photography, which is about 90% of what I use a camera for, it performed poorly.  The sharpness was lacking when compared back-to-back to the A630.  In daylight conditions, in at least 50% of the pictures, the A630 looked sharper and clearer compared to the XS, with the remaining about equal visual quality.  When using a PC and magnifying the resulting pictures on specific features, the A630 had better or equal resolution on the details.To be fair, I did spend about 3-4 hours adjusting the XS setting using User Defined settings(sharpness, contrast, etc.), and after lots of trial-and-error I was eventually able to consistently get pictures of equal quality to the A630 - in the A630's Auto mode.  I do not think that is acceptable for a DSLR, entry level or not.  I even borrowed several Canon lenses from a friend with a DSLR, and while the pictures were slightly better-or-equal with "prime" lenses, the difference was not worth the price.  Other zoom lenses gave the same results as the Kit 18-55mm lens.  In fact, I also used their XSi, and while the pictures were marginally better, that for sure was not worth the extr $300 (at the time of this writing).I have returned the camera to Amazon and will instead wait for the more expensive DSLRs to come down to a reasonable price.  Hopefully, the sensor/camera/software combination for one of those models will be more applicable to landscape photography.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for a starter camera.
Reviews.Author: Michael Scarn "Not an Idiot"
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for someone that is JUST STARTING to get into photography. The only reason you should want to get this camera is the price tag. I have owned mine for about a year now and It did what a starter camera should: It taught me how to shoot with a DSLR. Now that I have that down, I see the flaws of owning this camera.  The camera is light, just over 700 grams, and it has no fancy 'leatherette' on the grip. It sounds like a luxury, but the plastic on the grip is cheap feeling. By no means is it actually cheap, but you do spend 500$ or so on the camera.... The plastic body is top notch construction and I don't see it breaking anytime soon, with normal wear.The Frames Per Second speed is slow so that may be an issue on what you shoot. All settings are kept at a general scale. other, more expensive DSLR's, offer more accurate settings, like 640 ISO, unlike the 400 ISO-800 ISO on the XS. The 10MP sensor is fine for low light situations and Noise performance is great. If you plan on cropping a lot of your photos, you're going to lose quality, and quick. With this camera, I learned to shoot the photo great the first time, so that I would not have to crop.  One experience I had with this camera was an Error 99 during a SHOOTING SESSION. While i was mad that I couldn't take any more photos, I understood that, as an electronic, It had the potential to fail, like all electronics. I sent it into Canon and had the camera back within a week and a half. I wouldn't disregard Canon cameras for this error because Canon has good customer service.  If you think of going pro or want nothing but the best for your photos, you'd sell this baby quick. it doesn't take video which, for me, doesn't matter, but with many DSLR's shooting video now, it seems outdated. The 10 MP sensor is poor for cropping and the slow FPS make this a 'cheap-pro' camera. But it's not a bad camera. It just might not be the choice for someone that would like to REALLY get into photography.  A tip: If you plan on buying this camera anyways and upgrading later, take GREAT care of it. that way you can make 500$ or so when It's time to upgrade.

Even the kit lens comes with silent (and better) focusing, the Canon one doesn't.I've sent my Rebel XS for repairs, hope I can sell it for at least some ridiculous amount to get some of my money back.I'm not the only one having this kind of problem with the XS.Wrote to Canon, they answered with some semiautomated message: clean your lens contacts blah blah, etc which I already did.I will never buy Canon products again.
